commit_message:
Drop compatibility for assertRaisesRegexp

assertRaisesRegexp was deprecated in py3, but py2 didn't have its
replacement yet. To keep compatibility while reducing deprecation log
messages, handling was put in place to use the appropriate call based on
the runtime. Since we are now py3-only, we no longer need this
compatibility handling in place.

Change-Id: I0e7e82f99cf7246a4d2dc4cd5488b362b97da892
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Update lower-constraints versions
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-09 18:37:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2020-06-10 13:02:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Sean,

Did you just copy this over from the root project or something? I don't think any of the added dependencies are actually required by glance_store. Should we really be adding these?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-10 13:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hi Sean,
 > 
 > Did you just copy this over from the root project or something? I
 > don't think any of the added dependencies are actually required by
 > glance_store. Should we really be adding these?

That is intentional with the lower-constraints file. This is generated based off of the pip freeze output limiting our packages to the minimum versions that we need, and getting the resulting set of all dependencies that the direct dependencies pull in.

More information on how lower constraints works can be found in Doug's original post on its introduction here:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html

Search for "Testing Lower Bounds of Dependencies" in there.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-08-27 19:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-12-04 19:08:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2020-06-09 18:37:01.000000000', 'message': 'Update lower-constraints versions

This updates lower constraints to versions that will work with py38 so
that when we move to running on focal nodes, which has py38 as its
default py3 runtime, the lower-constraints job will continue to pass.

It also cleans out some secondary requirements that are no longer needed
due to our direct dependencies being updated.

Linters are removed that are kept in the global requirements blacklist
as those are not version tracked and are not relevant for our
lower-constraints unit test runs.

Change-Id: Icef16ed3910158484240eec6c07b3078043df5e7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update lower-constraints versions

This updates lower constraints to versions that will work with py38 so
that when we move to running on focal nodes, which has py38 as its
default py3 runtime, the lower-constraints job will continue to pass.

It also cleans out some secondary requirements that are no longer needed
due to our direct dependencies being updated.

Linters are removed that are kept in the global requirements blacklist
as those are not version tracked and are not relevant for our
lower-constraints unit test runs.

Change-Id: Icef16ed3910158484240eec6c07b3078043df5e7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Set reasonable default for octavia_ceilometer_enabled

By the analogy with other services we define _ceilometer_enabled variable
based on the presence of the ceilometer hosts in group.

Change-Id: I8389e9245e3f0483b9ddc9127941be32c30bc8a7

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-03 12:09:41.000000000', 'message': "Do not print btrfs error in log

Btrfs error are pretty confusing while reading CI logs, while they
are pretty normal to have in case provided directories are not btrfs ones
While this won't be an issue for CentOS 8 which do not have btrfs binary
Ubuntu would claim that provided directories are not btrfs ones or even
do not exist.

Change-Id: I1b932877b1dc57d065e9eebc7cbd20712515efd5
Related-Bug: #1855754
"}]
commit_message:
Do not print btrfs error in log

Btrfs error are pretty confusing while reading CI logs, while they
are pretty normal to have in case provided directories are not btrfs ones
While this won't be an issue for CentOS 8 which do not have btrfs binary
Ubuntu would claim that provided directories are not btrfs ones or even
do not exist.

Change-Id: I1b932877b1dc57d065e9eebc7cbd20712515efd5
Related-Bug: #1855754

commit_message:
Do not warn about incorrect group naming

Since ansible 2.8 dashes and other symbols (except undersocre) should not
be used in ansible group names. Until we did resilent migration of group
names to the new format we can just silence warnings during
openstack-ansible execution.

Change-Id: I5736b45172db9938174cce4f0d0c8830e8b8cdf1

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: Ic52698b4147d451e0b5ce25dbbf83083ccd69115

commit_message:
Change registry for fetching coredns image.

We see a lot of issues regarding fetching images from docker.io, due to
their latest changes to the quota policy, so that we decided to move to
registry quay.io.

Change-Id: Ia91ad1c3384a35bb9c87c092e20862a188aa2fdf
(cherry picked from commit 42b5790064bb785d1bb5c79cf10f9507c364559d)

commit_message:
Remove OOL

The OpenStack on LXD instructions were migrated to
the openstack-on-lxd repository.

As the CG officially represents the OpenStack Charms
project this change lowers priority for the maintenance
of OOL documentation significantly.

Change-Id: I595aa5c55dc70c7308cef62d7252a7dd1b256e18

commit_message:
Use synchronize module for rings distribution

Instead of using rsync which do not respect ssh ports, we fetch rings
to the deploy host and distribute them back to swift hosts

Change-Id: I9f8bc0af9803d2a235b3da956b5618adfe195c00
Closes-Bug: #1904935

[{'created': '2020-10-05 13:07:32.000000000', 'message': "Include python36-devel in bindep

After https://review.opendev.org/#/c/751112/
py36 tests fail w/
  psutil/_psutil_common.c:9:10: fatal error: Python.h: No such file or directory
  #include <Python.h>
           ^~~~~~~~~~
  compilation terminated.
  error: command 'gcc' failed with exit status 1

Although this change was reverted, it will eventually be
re-added later in the Wallaby cycle so fix the issue now.

Change-Id: Iab14c77f956e86d6690d1ce7cd55dd43a585b5bc
"}]
commit_message:
Include python36-devel in bindep

After https://review.opendev.org/#/c/751112/
py36 tests fail w/
  psutil/_psutil_common.c:9:10: fatal error: Python.h: No such file or directory
  #include <Python.h>
           ^~~~~~~~~~
  compilation terminated.
  error: command 'gcc' failed with exit status 1

Although this change was reverted, it will eventually be
re-added later in the Wallaby cycle so fix the issue now.

Change-Id: Iab14c77f956e86d6690d1ce7cd55dd43a585b5bc

A change recently moved the Kubeconfig in airshipctl [0] to a Kustomize
entrypoint that this repository does not consume. Because the Kubeconfig
is missing from the document set, the CI gate is failing. This change
adds a Kustomize entrypoint for the Kubeconfig in order to consume it
and restore the gate job.

commit_message:
Update test-site phases Kustomize entry point

A change recently moved the Kubeconfig in airshipctl [0] to a Kustomize
entrypoint that this repository does not consume. Because the Kubeconfig
is missing from the document set, the CI gate is failing. This change
updates the test-site/phases entry point to consume the new entry point
in which airshipctl exposes the Kubeconfig.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/756520

Change-Id: I75e410d550434fb3d8133aa2487eb2bec97a2a9a
Signed-off-by: Drew Walters <andrew.walters@att.com>

commit_message:
Add master and release tempest jobs

OVN Octavia provider driver relies now on new features
comming from OVN master. That means that would be great
to use master, at least in the check queue.

Change-Id: Ifd909f03c00b403837c513afdde085442cf9ccd8

commit_message:
Release python-brick-cinderclient-ext for wallaby-1 milestone

This is a library release for python-brick-cinderclient-ext for the wallaby-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

Change-Id: I8f43db1432bb0dfae22ae1ee7010e52e2c1e7429

commit_message:
Change devstack script to correctly configure driver

With the OVN devstack code now in-tree, either Q_AGENT
or NEUTRON_AGENT can be set to "ovn", but the provider
driver plugin was only checking for the latter. This led
to things not being installed or configured depending on
how local.conf was written. Let's support either.

Change-Id: I230cc82559b4cc86d6443bff89881dba55b52503

commit_message:
Reduce number of processes on small systems

Even the most modest 4C/8T system would run with the maximum 16 processes
due to the calculation being VCPU*2.

We devide amount of CPUs to number of threads for hyperthreaded CPUs

Change-Id: I5a301ce51f28eb935ade9727880534aced5fe927

messages:
[{'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-10-21 20:25:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-10-22 12:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-11-11 20:38:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-11-12 16:26:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-12-04 16:08:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 20:25:02.000000000', 'message': 'Retry status updates to Octavia

When the OVN Octavia Provider driver calls into
octavia-lib to update the status of a loadbalancer,
it might fail. This can happen if a resource associated
with the loadbalancer was not found, for example, if
it's DB transaction was in-flight.

A side-effect is the resource can become "stuck":

$ openstack loadbalancer listener delete $ID
Load Balancer $ID is immutable and cannot be updated.

The provider driver needs to retry the operation,
typically even the very next call succeeds.

Change-Id: Ia4460dd0ae22949920f3f304b315e3c3f32f89c0
Closes-bug: #1900763
'}]
commit_message:
Retry status updates to Octavia

When the OVN Octavia Provider driver calls into
octavia-lib to update the status of a loadbalancer,
it might fail. This can happen if a resource associated
with the loadbalancer was not found, for example, if
it's DB transaction was in-flight.

A side-effect is the resource can become "stuck":

$ openstack loadbalancer listener delete $ID
Load Balancer $ID is immutable and cannot be updated.

The provider driver needs to retry the operation,
typically even the very next call succeeds.

Change-Id: Ia4460dd0ae22949920f3f304b315e3c3f32f89c0
Closes-bug: #1900763

subject: gate fix: no removed tail_log in devstack, disable grenade
messages: [{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-12-04 11:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-12-04 13:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2020-12-04 15:33:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-04 11:57:54.000000000', 'message': 'devstack fix: do not call tail_log (removed)

The devstack tail_log function has been deprecated since before Queens
and it only printed a warning. It has been removed from devstack
in I7bd440adf2ce8283e3ad3d5d09e6b2b877e2b42e.

This fix unbreak the sahara devstack plugin.

Change-Id: I921d7bac5963c66e14a6a06b100d624924914f5a
'}, {'created': '2020-12-04 13:58:25.000000000', 'message': "gate fix: no removed tail_log in devstack, disable grenade

The devstack tail_log function has been deprecated since before Queens
and it has only printed a warning since then. It has been finally
removed from devstack in I7bd440adf2ce8283e3ad3d5d09e6b2b877e2b42e.

The sahara-grenade job is failing and it will continue to fail until
the heat devstack plugin is fixed on all stable branches
(currently broken due to the usage of an older Fedora image which
doesn't exist anymore, see Id869f83a46454897c2fe7a532eebfa2863befe5e),
so disable it.

Change-Id: I921d7bac5963c66e14a6a06b100d624924914f5a
"}]
commit_message:
gate fix: no removed tail_log in devstack, disable grenade

The devstack tail_log function has been deprecated since before Queens
and it has only printed a warning since then. It has been finally
removed from devstack in I7bd440adf2ce8283e3ad3d5d09e6b2b877e2b42e.

The sahara-grenade job is failing and it will continue to fail until
the heat devstack plugin is fixed on all stable branches
(currently broken due to the usage of an older Fedora image which
doesn't exist anymore, see Id869f83a46454897c2fe7a532eebfa2863befe5e),
so disable it.

Change-Id: I921d7bac5963c66e14a6a06b100d624924914f5a

commit_message:
Move to quay.io with kuryr/demo docker image.

use docker registry to 'quay.io/demo/kuryr' which will hint about
quay.io registry.

commit_message:
Change registry for fetching coredns image.

We see a lot of issues regarding fetching images from docker.io, due to
their latest changes to the quota policy, so that we decided to move to
registry quay.io.

Change-Id: Ia91ad1c3384a35bb9c87c092e20862a188aa2fdf
(cherry picked from commit 42b5790064bb785d1bb5c79cf10f9507c364559d)

Provide a little more understanding to resource
files in this context.

Minor wording improvements.

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ic435def472b13d5c89645c2bb083702cb251d132

commit_message:
Move to quay.io with kuryr/demo docker image.

Change documentation and tests from 'demo/kuryr' which by default will
use docker registry to 'quay.io/demo/kuryr' which will hint about
quay.io registry.

Change-Id: I7edc6bd8fed2943acf78ce2b66c44c91b1c33114
(cherry picked from commit 293750c9db8c23a48203d7e25ff8468ad28ba65b)

commit_message:
port c7 molecule job to c8 - part 3

- ovs-dpdk
- backup-and-restore
- tripleo-nova-image-cache
- tripleo-packages

It also removes centos-7 base job definition.

https://review.opendev.org/q/I067046e5fd4d56cd88712f553e25a61db60ced7f
removes the update molecule jobs.

Bump the base job timeout to 3600 to avoid timeout.

Change-Id: Iec2d798155c2a7c5dafb848072b6f440f5bb45ad
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Revert "ensure dlrn current is actually pulling current"

This reverts commit dc25776f630bfc9e90965a6d3c7e8d23aec8232c.

Reason for revert: With the patch overridden dlrn_hash_tag_newest will
not work, also the actual issue seems due to mirror sync so let's use
non mirror urls to get hash and fallback to mirror ones.

Change-Id: I4a859f3146b4d8c03d2e97405d4412d31b6c329c
Related-Bug: #1906347

and reading. What causes an error during minor update, the keystone
client calls the command to list the openstack projects. So we have a
python unicode error. For rabbitmq we force the utf-8 local, so we

commit_message:
Add a validation to check the local.

I don't know how to explain how it happens, but we have had several
customers case[1], for example, different local for writing to the database
and reading. What causes an error during minor update, the keystone
client calls the command to list the openstack projects. So we have a
python unicode error. For rabbitmq we force the utf-8 local, so we
decided that we assume that we must be in utf-8 everywhere. Add this
validation to ensure the local system is configure with the good local.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1824513

Change-Id: I8b8f2a17a4963af46dd2c5407fb089414a804247
(cherry picked from commit 6521f1b81adf9502bc2ab10fa72fd75b20348037)
(cherry picked from commit e18073465a5687ff1aca362410ebaa87aa6349cd)

CinderBackendPowerFlex.

Closes-Bug: #1903634

commit_message:
Fix barbican settings missing from glance Edge nodes

Fix the BarbicanClient THT to include 'glance_api_edge' in the tripleo
services that require access to Barbican.

Closes-Bug: #1905439

(cherry picked from commit 89fcfa5fabadcd4de1bbd7ce13044b2a7ee230ec)

commit_message:
Fix networks_skip_config condition in nic templates

This fixes the condition check and removes the default as
we now pass [] with https://review.opendev.org/763296. Fixes
similar issue in single_nic_vlans/controller_no_external.j2.

Also changes to use ubi:8.2 image for molecule tests as 8.3
seems broken.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/763296
Change-Id: Ia2ef1fe8de4247f793d3bb0197e03a43cc564c71
(cherry picked from commit 4788cb88cab77e641d041be9b20b804cd02cbcaa)

commit_message:
Release tosca-parser for wallaby-1 milestone

This is a library release for tosca-parser for the wallaby-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

Change-Id: If82ce7774dc3e494e1926bf1d28f11d6fdb1763b

[{'created': '2020-11-24 19:22:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix stackviz for failed tempest runs

ansible block w/ error handling was incorrect: the first block
failed when tempest executed, then the second one (which creates
stackviz) never got executed.

It also includes in the block assertion to check if tempest
failed (this is actually redundant check, not really needed).

Change-Id: Ie99060fce29f35ced77efb7b29b8f5f6e37abbcd
Closes-Bug: #1905460
'}]
commit_message:
Fix stackviz for failed tempest runs

ansible block w/ error handling was incorrect: the first block
failed when tempest executed, then the second one (which creates
stackviz) never got executed.

It also includes in the block assertion to check if tempest
failed (this is actually redundant check, not really needed).

Change-Id: Ie99060fce29f35ced77efb7b29b8f5f6e37abbcd
Closes-Bug: #1905460

commit_message:
Replace Fedora test image with F32

Fedora 31 was retired and the image is gone from mirrors.
heat-cfntools have been dropped from fedora images, disable
the test till that's resolved.

Also makes grenade job non-voting, till this is backported
to stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Id869f83a46454897c2fe7a532eebfa2863befe5e

[{'created': '2020-09-22 15:33:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes API list handling of unscoped tokens

If the API is using the admin_or_owner-policy.yaml policy override file,
and a user used an unscoped token, the API will list objects for all
projects. This patch corrects that issue.
If you are using the default policies, the API handles unscoped tokens
correctly.

commit_message:
Fixes API list handling of unscoped tokens

The API list methods were not handling unscoped tokens correctly.
If the API is using the admin_or_owner-policy.yaml policy override file,
and a user used an unscoped token, the API will list objects for all
projects. This patch corrects that issue.
If you are using the default policies, the API handles unscoped tokens
correctly.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/753838
Change-Id: I88e64fd5e8a4c709f735be85b85139dbb52e4acd
(cherry picked from commit 9453701fb46f0ad23dae00b3a3792bb379978d0e)

commit_message:
Fix load balancers with failed amphora failover

There was a bug in the load balancer failover code for the amphora
v1 driver where if there were multiple failed amphora, with session
persistence, could cause a load balancer failover to not complete.

Change-Id: Ia46a05ab9fdc97ed9be699e5b2ae90daca3ab9a2
Story: 2008099
Task: 40802
(cherry picked from commit 77dc23fc26cbb8c6488b5205c63bf7cc847a9c32)

The addition of 

@reactive.when_not('ha.available')

to the flags of the cluster_connected handler results in an interesting race condition:

* hacluster may process ha-relation-changed before manila-ganesha processes ha-relation-joined and expose clustered="yes" to the relation;
* then ha-relation-joined runs at the manila-ganesha side and, as a result, cluster_connected never gets to run because ha.available is already set.

There needs to be another flag to indicate whether a resource has been exposed or not (we have a similar issue in charm-gnocchi).


manila-ganesha/2          active    idle   13       10.5.0.30                                   Unit is ready
  hacluster/0*            active    idle            10.5.0.30                                   Unit is ready and clustered


hacluster/0 (subordinate):
07 Aug 2020 13:47:37Z  juju-unit  executing    running ha-relation-joined hook
07 Aug 2020 13:47:58Z  juju-unit  executing    running ha-relation-changed hook

manila-ganesha/2 (primary):
07 Aug 2020 13:52:33Z  juju-unit  executing  running ha-relation-joined hook

* manila-share/0 got (re)started 2 times;
* manila-share/0 successfully triggered client eviction during the CephFS client initialization at its startup;
* the first create_volume request triggered by a share creation from the client resulted in "Cannot send after transport endpoint shutdown"

* when I reproduced the issue on my environment and later created another share I did not get the same error following the initial one.

By the looks of it the is_clustered check needs to be used slightly differently:

https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/blob/v0.20.18/charmhelpers/contrib/hahelpers/cluster.py#L111-L119
def is_clustered():
    for r_id in (relation_ids('ha') or []):
        for unit in (relation_list(r_id) or []):
            clustered = relation_get('clustered',
                                     rid=r_id,
                                     unit=unit)
            if clustered:
                return True
    return False


Since the expectation is that an hacluster subordinate will write "clustered" to the relation for a primary to read, if manila-ganesha unit has a relation to hacluster, it needs to wait until "is_clustered == True" before doing any restarts (i.e. skip the restarts, not fall back to the systemctl method of doing a restart).

The feedback loop event for manila-ganesha units to do the skipped restarts is the presence of "clustered" on the relation to hacluster since it will trigger a "relation-changed" event.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2020-11-02 18:57:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)

You don't need to do this but I think this would have been easier to review if it was split into separate commits with Depends-On."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2020-11-02 20:09:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

HA testing was added in:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728929/
d4f0215a1b5923645ad0bd0af6912afacbc1ea8f

However, the Ussuri bundles were not modified to have multiple units of
manila-ganesha.

It went unnoticed since the reviews that added Ussuri testing and HA
testing were considered in parallel and passed full-rechecks
independently.

1. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715998/
2. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728929/

(2) was not rebased on top of (1) and the full recheck for (1) passed
because it did not include the Ussuri bundles.

'}, {'created': '2020-10-29 20:35:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix HA setup and test bundles

cluster_connected was called without the necessary gating - even after
HA was set up it was called on every hook execution (including
update-status) which caused services manila-share and nfs-ganesha
services to be stopped and disabled.

Bundle fixes:

HA testing was added in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728929/
(d4f0215a1b5923645ad0bd0af6912afacbc1ea8f).

However, the Ussuri bundles were not modified to have multiple units of
manila-ganesha.

It went unnoticed since the reviews that added Ussuri testing and HA
testing were considered in parallel and passed full-rechecks
independently.

1. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715998/
2. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728929/

(2) was not rebased on top of (1) and the full recheck for (1) passed
because it did not include the Ussuri bundles.

Functional fixes:

Service restarts for manila-share and nfs-ganesha services are no longer
done via systemctl in the HA scenario to avoid undesired side-effects.
Namely, a restart of manila-share triggers a client connection to
ceph-fs which clears sessions for other manila-share clients which
causes further failures on other manila-share units. Pacemaker keeps one
manila-share instance alive in the cluster and spurious restarts of this
service on other units via systemctl are avoided by using crm_resource.

Change-Id: I887c3383c0dc43702f5e85ec56bc0716020c5b06
Closes-Bug: #1890330
Closes-Bug: #1890401
Related-Bug: #1867358
Related-Bug: #1891160

'}, {'created': '2020-11-17 22:45:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix HA setup/bundles and allow renaming

This change makes updates to support HA as well as manila-ganesha application
renaming.

The manila-ganesha charm supports active/passive HA. This is done by
co-locating manila-share and nfs-ganesha systemd services on the same unit,
and ensuring that those services are only running on the master unit with
the VIP. Once an HA deployment is complete, pacemaker will ensure that only
one unit is running the services.

If a second unit starts the services while the first is connected to CephFS,
the first will be evicted and its session state corrupted.

This patch ensures that the services are disabled/stopped until the HA
cluster setup is complete. This patch also overrides service_(re)start
methods so that they cooperate with pacemaker and allow pacemaker to control
any service starts. Both of these changes prevent a second unit from
starting services while the first is connected to CephFS. For example,
if charm config is changed, services will only be stopped by the charm
and pacemaker will start them.

Once HA setup is complete, pacemaker will ensure that only one unit has
running services. However, there is still a risk that a systemd service is
restarted manually by a user or other means, therefore the README is
updated to describe this situation.

This change also ensures that cluster_connected is called with necessary
gating rather than on every hook execution.

This change also removes some hard-coding in the charm that prevented the
charm from working if the application name was changed to something other
than manila-ganesha.

Finally, test bundles are updated to run clustered with hacluster and renamed
application name.

Change-Id: I887c3383c0dc43702f5e85ec56bc0716020c5b06
Closes-Bug: #1890330
Closes-Bug: #1890401
Related-Bug: #1867358
Related-Bug: #1891160
Related-Bug: #1904623
Func-Test-PR: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/461

restarted manually by a user or other means, therefore the README is
updated to describe this situation.

This change also ensures that cluster_connected is called with necessary
gating rather than on every hook execution.

This change also removes some hard-coding in the charm that prevented the
charm from working if the application name was changed to something other
than manila-ganesha.

Finally, test bundles are updated to run clustered with hacluster and renamed
application name.

commit_message:
Fix HA setup/bundles and allow renaming

This change makes updates to support HA as well as manila-ganesha application
renaming.

The manila-ganesha charm supports active/passive HA. This is done by
co-locating manila-share and nfs-ganesha systemd services on the same unit,
and ensuring that those services are only running on the master unit with
the VIP. Once an HA deployment is complete, pacemaker will ensure that only
one unit is running the services.

If a second unit starts the services while the first is connected to CephFS,
the first will be evicted and its session state corrupted.

This patch ensures that the services are disabled/stopped until the HA
cluster setup is complete. This patch also overrides service_(re)start
methods so that they cooperate with pacemaker. Both of these changes
prevent a second unit from starting services while the first is connected
to CephFS. For example, if charm config is changed, services will only be
restarted on the master unit where they were running prior to the config
change.

Once HA setup is complete, pacemaker will ensure that only one unit has
running services. However, there is still a risk that a systemd service is
restarted manually by a user or other means, therefore the README is
updated to describe this situation.

This change also ensures that cluster_connected is called with necessary
gating rather than on every hook execution.

This change also removes some hard-coding in the charm that prevented the
charm from working if the application name was changed to something other
than manila-ganesha.

Finally, test bundles are updated to run clustered with hacluster and renamed
application name.

Change-Id: I887c3383c0dc43702f5e85ec56bc0716020c5b06
Closes-Bug: #1890330
Closes-Bug: #1890401
Related-Bug: #1867358
Related-Bug: #1891160
Related-Bug: #1904623
Func-Test-PR: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/461

commit_message:
Exit with zero status when denials are not found in audit log

When no denials are found in the audit log file, grep will exit with 1
and this ansible task will be caught by the callback as a failed task.

Change-Id: I95f782c02bdf3446f6b6e461973e8226a8d2a699
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add default value for validation.py inventory

Add default value as localhost for the inventory
option of the validation.py cli script

Fix related CI issues that comes with this change:
* add block for only check sestatus when a stdout is defined
* add extra_vars to the validation.py script to be able
  to configure the check-ram validation for CI envirnonment.

Change-Id: I2aaaa702d587b9ea5b79338c4b1dbf426e2b581d

older than v0.11.0

commit_message:
Add Influxdb Python client v5.3.1 compatibility

- Add a checker of version using the method ping()
if it failes, maybe because of an old version,
the flow will try with SHOW DIAGNOSTICS.

- Keep the timestamp output to 3 decimal digits as
it is working currently, independently of the version
of Influx Python Client (v5.2.3 or v5.3.1).

- Remove the support for Influxdb (the database)
older than v0.11.0

- Unittests: Adding data to handle more than 3 decimal
digits in timestamp, updating the tests to use mocks
for Influxdb from_0.11.0, creating the mocks with
from_0.11.0 explicitly.

- This change fixes monasca-tempest-python3-influxdb
Zuul job.

Change-Id: I5f8e6d2f0b56813f54fe025f91996b9d6863eadc
Story: 2007624
Task: 39658

commit_message:
Correct format string in error message

Due to a syntax error, values are not being interpolated into a
message format string.  This patch corrects the error.

Closes-Bug: #1906605
Change-Id: Ibecc6d05230255978803898286f6a86911f1b6b6

commit_message:
Allow kwargs in create_volume_from_image

As a part of the scenario/manager.py stabilization tracked by
the below BP the patch adds kwargs argument for create_volume_from_image
method so that the consumers are able to pass additional
parameters if needed.

Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable
Change-Id: I0eaa3bbbdceae21b9fc0e973bfeab971b06070bc

commit_message:
Release os-vif for wallaby-1 milestone

This is a library release for os-vif for the wallaby-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

Change-Id: I7456783361fda3adce51d1e8915e2283c58efd70

subject: Fix disk mount options
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-12-03 13:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-12-03 13:38:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nThis is currently causing failure in centos-8-beaker job, since now CentOS8 uses kernel >= 4.19 .'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-12-03 17:10:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2020-12-04 06:53:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-03 13:35:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix disk mount options

The nobarrier option is invalid in recent kernels (>= 4.19), and having
it makes the mount fail. It has no effect on kernel >= 4.10.

Also, adding "nofail" to avoid failure when booting a server if
there is a broken drive, which is common on a large cluster.

Change-Id: Ib5262c26244363a1c47bdd562d560735ddc82a36
(cherry picked from commit 3c3a1212b802e9463b22b5941ccac5001056fde4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix disk mount options

The nobarrier option is invalid in recent kernels (>= 4.19), and having
it makes the mount fail. It has no effect on kernel >= 4.10.

Also, adding "nofail" to avoid failure when booting a server if
there is a broken drive, which is common on a large cluster.

Change-Id: Ib5262c26244363a1c47bdd562d560735ddc82a36
(cherry picked from commit 3c3a1212b802e9463b22b5941ccac5001056fde4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-05 10:21:03.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure atomic inventory file rename runs on the same mountpoint

Linux rename system call is only supported on the same mountpoint [1].
/tmp is often a tmpfs mount, so instead generate the temp inventory file in
the same directory as the target inventory file.

[1] See EXDEV in https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/rename.2.html

Closes-bug: #1892008

commit_message:
Ensure atomic inventory file rename runs on the same mountpoint

Linux rename system call is only supported on the same mountpoint [1].
/tmp is often a tmpfs mount, so instead generate the temp inventory file in
the same directory as the target inventory file.

[1] See EXDEV in https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/rename.2.html

Change-Id: Id306243352f310f9054506577aa9bbce3790a7e5
Closes-bug: #1892008
(cherry picked from commit 662b0acd91266d28bf3b0b7a4c68ba919182c56a)

commit_message:
Add support for the interface parameter in authtoken middleware

This patch adds support for [keystone_authtoken] interface parameter,
so that operators can define which endpoint should be used by authtoken
middleware.

Change-Id: I74d848da4f2e923f224786fd55b35cb063bb59a1
(cherry picked from commit a6eae2f39ee8529bb4ae34ba6109e8a0582a8ebe)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-26 08:59:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix reconnect_interval on remotes with pcs 0.10

When switching to the pcs 0.10 providers we moved from the the general
pcmk_resource provider to the pcmk_remote backend. While doing this we
lost the ability to specify the reconnect_interval.

Tested by deploying tripleo with the following:
  ExtraConfig:
    pacemaker_remote_reconnect_interval: 180

And correctly observing that the remotes have the right
reconnect_interval:
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs resource config compute-0 |grep reconnect
  Attributes: reconnect_interval=180 server=172.17.1.96

Change-Id: Idb6e4ba4eadbeeb52b959bc688eb5e043f11c155
Closes-Bug: #1905606
'}]
commit_message:
Fix reconnect_interval on remotes with pcs 0.10

When switching to the pcs 0.10 providers we moved from the the general
pcmk_resource provider to the pcmk_remote backend. While doing this we
lost the ability to specify the reconnect_interval.

Tested by deploying tripleo with the following:
  ExtraConfig:
    pacemaker_remote_reconnect_interval: 180

And correctly observing that the remotes have the right
reconnect_interval:
[root@controller-0 ~]# pcs resource config compute-0 |grep reconnect
  Attributes: reconnect_interval=180 server=172.17.1.96

Change-Id: Idb6e4ba4eadbeeb52b959bc688eb5e043f11c155
Closes-Bug: #1905606

This has broken deployments with ml2/ovs with RDO as service neutron-destroy-patch-ports.service is using ovs-vsctl:


Dec 04 04:13:53 generic-puppet-openstack-001-17605.novalocal systemd[1]: Starting OpenStack Neutron Destroy Patch Ports...
Dec 04 04:13:55 generic-puppet-openstack-001-17605.novalocal sudo[85598]: pam_unix(sudo:auth): conversation failed
Dec 04 04:13:55 generic-puppet-openstack-001-17605.novalocal sudo[85598]: pam_unix(sudo:auth): auth could not identify password for [neutron]
Dec 04 04:13:55 generic-puppet-openstack-001-17605.novalocal sudo[85598]: pam_succeed_if(sudo:auth): requirement "uid >= 1000" not met by user "neutron"
Dec 04 04:13:57 generic-puppet-openstack-001-17605.novalocal sudo[85598]:  neutron : command not allowed ; TTY=unknown ; PWD=/ ; USER=root ; COMMAND=/bin/privsep-helper --config-file /usr/share/neutron/neutron-dist.conf --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/openvswitch_agent.ini --config-dir /etc/neutron/conf.d/neutron-openvswitch-agent --privsep_context neutron.privileged.ovs_vsctl_cmd --privsep_sock_path /tmp/tmpob77g63d/privsep.sock
Dec 04 04:13:57 generic-puppet-openstack-001-17605.novalocal systemd[1]: neutron-destroy-patch-ports.service: Main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE
Dec 04 04:13:57 generic-puppet-openstack-001-17605.novalocal systemd[1]: neutron-destroy-patch-ports.service: Failed with result 'exit-code'.
Dec 04 04:13:57 generic-puppet-openstack-001-17605.novalocal systemd[1]: Failed to start OpenStack Neutron Destroy Patch Ports.

See https://github.com/rdo-packages/neutron-distgit/blob/rpm-master/0002-Destroy-patch-ports-only-if-canary-flow-is-not-prese.patch

I'm not sure if that service is not longer needed and can be removed or ovs-ctl support must be reverted.'}]

commit_message:
Remove "ovs-vsctl" support from rootwrap

This command is executed from scripts and in sanity checks, but not
from any Neutron service.

Change-Id: If82e89bf7b233559513ab44eadebb445648f0684
Story: #2007686
Task: #41282

commit_message:
Add support for the interface parameter in authtoken middleware

This patch adds support for [keystone_authtoken] interface parameter,
so that operators can define which endpoint should be used by authtoken
middleware.

commit_message:
Add tag in compute interfaces schema for microversion 2.70

https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-port-interfaces
Optional field 'tag' is added in the response body of the following APIs
in compute microversion 2.70:
   - GET /servers/{server_id}/os-interface
   - POST /servers/{server_id}/os-interface
   - GET /servers/{server_id}/os-interface/{port_id}

This is to add it in the interface schema of compute microversion 2.70.

Implements: blueprint fix-microversion-gap

Change-Id: I6d5c27cadf75919a54e20eb2b095dec22817e47a

commit_message:
Add support for the interface parameter in authtoken middleware

This patch adds support for [keystone_authtoken] interface parameter,
so that operators can define which endpoint should be used by authtoken
middleware.

Change-Id: I02f2b0cfe4641616a59043c947c65d373597da55
(cherry picked from commit 3ac484f1d2aa0e84997cfddcb63d343cbda9a25b)

commit_message:
Add 'networks_all' ansible group_var

Add a group_var carrying all enabled overcloud
networks. The multi-nic templates should iterate
over all the networks in the order they apper in
network_data.yaml to allow maintaining the
network to nicX contract that existed in the Heat
mulit-nic config templates.

Change-Id: I69fa208d160f1ae2cb2cc252d9b7852ada9e96f0
Related-Bug: #1904894

commit_message:
Check project_id/tenant_id in API call

When project_id/tenant_id is present in an API call, Neutron
checks first if this project exists. If not, a HTTPNotFound
will be thrown.

This patch is tested in neutron-tempest-plugin:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/754390/

Closes-Bug: #1896588

Change-Id: I6276490d4df69ec0f2c9a1492b9b03d1130c7c05

commit_message:
Updated from generate-constraints

neutron-lib has it's own review
mock held back because nova
docutils held back because boto (iirc)
pkg-resources removed (not sure what's bringing it in)
setuptools readded (we need to either fix the job or remove it)

Change-Id: I57e2e63899e579e190d32c2e1b9c5ede623b26b7

commit_message:
Decrease MTU to account for IPv6 header

(MTU - 50) only supports VxLAN over IPv4, decrease it
to support IPv6 as well, which is 20 bytes larger.

Change-Id: I0cf258770f628c1b4fb590bd274b5433fbcc1450

commit_message:
Revert "Remove parameter nova::compute::pci_passthrough"

This should never have been merged.
It removed more than the deprecated param, breaking the pci config on
computes.
Also should have warned for at least 1 cycle before removal.
It also wasn't removed correctly as the pick remained in nova::compute::pci
so (IIUC) the deprecated param still works today if set in hieradata.

This reverts commit d845b6f0aefaaab0b65b32cd22ccda8c2c8ee6ae.

Change-Id: I5b3d9dbbd41d060134444609458b3e8bba606ae6

commit_message:
docs: add CAP_NET_ADMIN to service AmbientCapabilities

This adds CAP_NET_ADMIN to the list of capabilities available
to the service. This is most relevant when the service runs as a
non-root user.

Related-Bug: #1852105
Change-Id: Ie50c092b723a4e5e8fc501370547711b06f77f1c

commit_message:
Use mysql user instead of root

Using the mysql user is the safer option from a security point of
view. Also use a backups group with programmable GID to allow access
to read backups by other users.

Change-Id: Iff18c68f5662eae2dbbffa40ce9fb6f9cad7be72

subject: Remove run_as_root which fails without root_helper
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11536, 'name': 'hongbin', 'email': 'hongbin034@gmail.com', 'username': 'hongbin'}, {'_account_id': 11600, 'name': 'MichaÅ‚ Dulko', 'email': 'mdulko@redhat.com', 'username': 'dulek'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23567, 'name': 'Luis Tomas Bolivar', 'email': 'ltomasbo@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltomasbo'}, {'_account_id': 27032, 'name': 'Maysa de Macedo Souza', 'email': 'maysa.macedo95@gmail.com', 'username': 'maysa'}, {'_account_id': 28619, 'name': 'Dmitriy Rabotyagov', 'email': 'noonedeadpunk@gmail.com', 'username': 'noonedeadpunk'}, {'_account_id': 32029, 'name': 'likui', 'email': 'likui@yovole.com', 'username': 'likui'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2020-12-01 08:37:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2020-12-01 09:21:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Hm, let's see if I understand this correctly. So we have run_as_root there but we don't specify rootwrap_helper, so we cannot elevate privileges. Which effectively mean we just force this to fail with a weird message if not running as root user.

An alternative could be to use privsep as root_helper everywhere of course, but that won't work with direct calls to pyroute2. I doubt there's a way for pyroute2 to use privsep.

So instead of ambiguous `oslo_concurrency.processutils.NoRootWrapSpecified: Command requested root, but did not specify a root helper.` we'll just get a permissions error, which is way more descriptive.  This makes perfect sense then."}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2020-12-01 09:26:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That sounds like it matches what I've found. I did include a couple of draft patches in https://bugs.launchpad.net/kuryr/+bug/1852105 using root_helper or privsep but as you suggest the sticking point seemed to be pyroute2's requirements."}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2020-12-01 09:29:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> That sounds like it matches what I've found. I did include a couple of draft patches in https://bugs.launchpad.net/kuryr/+bug/1852105 using root_helper or privsep but as you suggest the sticking point seemed to be pyroute2's requirements.

Sure, in kuryr-kubernetes we're using pyroute2 extensively, but we're always running in a root container so we never got this issue. Thanks for the fix!"}, {'account_id': 32029, 'date': '2020-12-01 09:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-12-01 16:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2020-12-02 09:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2020-12-03 13:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Should the docs[1] get updated to account for AmbientCapabilities setting?

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/kuryr-libnetwork/latest/install/compute-install-ubuntu.html'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2020-12-03 14:13:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've just proposed a change to the docs in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork/+/765331 if that's of use."}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2020-12-04 01:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-01 08:37:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove run_as_root which fails without root_helper

It appears that this library is typically run as the root user
which shouldn't require 'run_as_root'. When running as an
unprivileged user the required permissions can be granted by
specifying 'AmbientCapabilities = CAP_NET_ADMIN' in the service,
rather than 'CapabilityBoundingSet'.

An alternative approach would be to specify a 'root_helper' or to
switch to oslo.privsep, but these don't fully solve the problem
as the 'pyroute2' library also requires 'CAP_NET_ADMIN'.

Closes-Bug: #1852105
Change-Id: I9d0942f1cfc06cc3a7585683a030516096297767
"}]
commit_message:
Remove run_as_root which fails without root_helper

It appears that this library is typically run as the root user
which shouldn't require 'run_as_root'. When running as an
unprivileged user the required permissions can be granted by
specifying 'AmbientCapabilities = CAP_NET_ADMIN' in the service,
rather than 'CapabilityBoundingSet'.

An alternative approach would be to specify a 'root_helper' or to
switch to oslo.privsep, but these don't fully solve the problem
as the 'pyroute2' library also requires 'CAP_NET_ADMIN'.

Closes-Bug: #1852105
Change-Id: I9d0942f1cfc06cc3a7585683a030516096297767

This patch moves detailed description about fullstack tests from
the general TESTING.rst document to the fullstack guide which is in
contributor/testing/fullstack.rst

It also adds new sections about running and debugging fullstack tests
locally and how to investigate failures which happens in the fullstack
jobs in the gate.

Change-Id: I2539420411e8fb2f54a5da9d9047171fd37bfb11

commit_message:
Ignore DELETED amphorae when performing certificate rotation

Deleted amphorae should not be included when housekeeping service is
performing certificate rotation. Otherwise, deleted amphorae will
become ERROR.

Story: #2007635
Task: #39681

Change-Id: Ie2c748ff69c8fd736e9c67d686068a33d803222e
(cherry picked from commit f3eff29ce17e5d27867b6e6f4049ae6d51d2751c)

commit_message:
Fix Go lint errors

Three Go lint errors are addressed in this patch:

- Don't use underscores in Go names
- Exported type ConnectionCount should have comment or be unexported
- Println arg list ends with redundant newline

Change-Id: I4774fd3f2837f474399d0735af0cd18322fe0eee

[{'created': '2020-12-01 15:44:33.000000000', 'message': 'Map cloud-guest-utils to cloud-utils-growpart for Red Hat distros.

The package cloud-utils-growpart is missing from Red Hat based image
builds which means the root filesystems are not grown on instance
startup which means not much space for things like logs.

This patch maps the cloud-guest-utils package to cloud-utils-growpart.

Change-Id: I3c830a9f0fd21ca10238946721c0f75d01d3ddff
Story: 2008350
Task: 41252
(cherry picked from commit 6d59fec8a0c8011949c547c4f49195c41b9d21a5)
'}]
commit_message:
Map cloud-guest-utils to cloud-utils-growpart for Red Hat distros.

The package cloud-utils-growpart is missing from Red Hat based image
builds which means the root filesystems are not grown on instance
startup which means not much space for things like logs.

This patch maps the cloud-guest-utils package to cloud-utils-growpart.

Change-Id: I3c830a9f0fd21ca10238946721c0f75d01d3ddff
Story: 2008350
Task: 41252
(cherry picked from commit 6d59fec8a0c8011949c547c4f49195c41b9d21a5)

commit_message:
Update octavia messaging options

Some of the options we were configuring were dropped from upstream service
back in Stein with api v1. So we dropped removed options, renamed
deprecated ones and moved to the appropriate sections were applicable.
We also enable notifications conditionally now depending on the value of
the variable `octavia_ceilometer_enabled`.

Change-Id: Ia44da67bb7116122633117ae17794aa58236ef83

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-26 15:39:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix missing node facts with BIFROST_INVENTORY_SOURCE=ironic

In Ussuri and earlier releases, the Bifrost custom inventory returns all
node fields as facts. Currently, most of these are returned as null.
This happened following the switch to openstacksdk. The plugin checks
for the presence of a properties field, and gets detailed node
information if it is missing. This worked with shade, but with
openstacksdk, the returned node object has most fields present but set
to null.

One of the most obvious consequences is that provisioning fails, since
it tries to use the instance_info value of null.

This change fixes the issue by removing the check and always getting the
detailed node information.

Change-Id: Ia87c8332994f3b0f037ada953a299987bba246e5
Story: 2008394
Task: 41321

commit_message:
Fix missing node facts with BIFROST_INVENTORY_SOURCE=ironic

In Ussuri and earlier releases, the Bifrost custom inventory returns all
node fields as facts. Currently, most of these are returned as null.
This happened following the switch to openstacksdk. The plugin checks
for the presence of a properties field, and gets detailed node
information if it is missing. This worked with shade, but with
openstacksdk, the returned node object has most fields present but set
to null.

One of the most obvious consequences is that provisioning fails, since
the 'Deploy to hardware - Using custom instance_info.' task tries to use
the instance_info value of null.

This change fixes the issue by removing the check and always getting the
detailed node information.

Change-Id: Ia87c8332994f3b0f037ada953a299987bba246e5
Story: 2008394
Task: 41321

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-18 12:11:46.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure tripleo ansible inventory file update is atomic

Multiple python-tripleoclient commands can run concurrently
and all attempt to update the same inventory file in
~/tripleo-ansible-inventory.yaml. Make the update atomic to
ensure the inventory file is always complete/valid.

(cherry picked from commit 8e082f45ddfb8f29bd02feb1c9fd1ace4e9ec6dd)

(squashing commits as the 1st patch is failing in the stein gate without
the fix from the 2nd patch)

Ensure atomic inventory file rename runs on the same mountpoint

Linux rename system call is only supported on the same mountpoint [1].
/tmp is often a tmpfs mount, so instead generate the temp inventory file in
the same directory as the target inventory file.

[1] See EXDEV in https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/rename.2.html

Closes-bug: #1892008
(cherry picked from commit 662b0acd91266d28bf3b0b7a4c68ba919182c56a)

Change-Id: Ifa41bfcb921496978f82aee4e67fdb419cf9ffc5
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure tripleo ansible inventory file update is atomic

Multiple python-tripleoclient commands can run concurrently
and all attempt to update the same inventory file in
~/tripleo-ansible-inventory.yaml. Make the update atomic to
ensure the inventory file is always complete/valid.

(cherry picked from commit 8e082f45ddfb8f29bd02feb1c9fd1ace4e9ec6dd)

(squashing commits as the 1st patch is failing in the stein gate without
the fix from the 2nd patch)

Ensure atomic inventory file rename runs on the same mountpoint

Linux rename system call is only supported on the same mountpoint [1].
/tmp is often a tmpfs mount, so instead generate the temp inventory file in
the same directory as the target inventory file.

[1] See EXDEV in https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/rename.2.html

Closes-bug: #1892008
(cherry picked from commit 662b0acd91266d28bf3b0b7a4c68ba919182c56a)

Change-Id: Ifa41bfcb921496978f82aee4e67fdb419cf9ffc5

commit_message:
Bump galera version to 10.5.2

This patch also fixes an error introduced in change id
I2e9ee987a353a28da00cd37cbdb82ec46ccc414c where the galera server
version used to set up the repos is driven by version variables defined
in the galera client role.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/682229
Change-Id: I883a4d8e5df1df942ffc98f5b2158d665354d888

commit_message:
Replace hardcoded mtu value with a cloud_mtu variable

Use variable to configure physical mtu for eth2 interface (default to 1450).

This mtu value should be set using value defined on the network where the
instance is deployed.

For user, it's possible to set 'cloud_mtu' on variable in the zuul job
definition if the network mtu is not 1450.

Change-Id: I53299293bca8cd1cfd9a5ecf1fd46368ade001f9

commit_message:
Update retiring Searchlight repo ACL to openstack/retired.config

Searchlight project is retiring in Wallaby cycle[1].
This commit updates the ACl for Searchlight repos
to openstack/retired.config so that TC can finish
the project repo code removal and close open reviews.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/searchlight/+/764526
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-searchlightclient/+/764529
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/searchlight-ui/+/764528
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/searchlight-specs/+/764527

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018637.html

Change-Id: I989a095075b970aad9bf79d225388ce18359ba97

(1 comment)

Please see my inline comment.  There is a problem with the upgrade order for openstack (not in this review), where the order (as done in tests is):

    ('Database Services', ['percona-cluster', 'mysql-innodb-cluster']),
    ('Stateful Services', ['rabbitmq-server', 'ceph-mon']),
    ('Core Identity', ['keystone']),
    ('Control Plane', [
        'aodh', 'barbican', 'ceilometer', 'ceph-fs',
        'ceph-radosgw', 'cinder', 'designate',
        'designate-bind', 'glance', 'gnocchi', 'heat', 'manila',
        'manila-generic', 'neutron-api', 'neutron-gateway', 'placement',
        'nova-cloud-controller', 'openstack-dashboard']),
    ('Data Plane', [
        'nova-compute', 'ceph-osd',
        'swift-proxy', 'swift-storage']))

In particular, (on series upgrade), ceph-mon does need to be done early, which is captured in the document, but I don't think percona and rabbit are mentioned in the upgrade order."}, {'account_id': 30561, 'date': '2020-12-02 19:25:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
[check-release-approval] Handle PTL-less projects

Not all teams have PTLs now. Don't assume we will get PTL information as
we check for approvals on release patches.

Change-Id: Id0d6eeaf66394806374781d1cf26c087a6e90f87
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-10-08 17:31:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix load balancers with failed amphora failover

There was a bug in the load balancer failover code for the amphora
v1 driver where if there were multiple failed amphora, with session
persistence, could cause a load balancer failover to not complete.

Change-Id: Ia46a05ab9fdc97ed9be699e5b2ae90daca3ab9a2
Story: 2008099
Task: 40802
(cherry picked from commit 77dc23fc26cbb8c6488b5205c63bf7cc847a9c32)
'}, {'created': '2020-12-01 17:02:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix load balancers with failed amphora failover

There was a bug in the load balancer failover code for the amphora
v1 driver where if there were multiple failed amphora, with session
persistence, could cause a load balancer failover to not complete.

Change-Id: Ia46a05ab9fdc97ed9be699e5b2ae90daca3ab9a2
Story: 2008099
Task: 40802
(cherry picked from commit 77dc23fc26cbb8c6488b5205c63bf7cc847a9c32)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix load balancers with failed amphora failover

There was a bug in the load balancer failover code for the amphora
v1 driver where if there were multiple failed amphora, with session
persistence, could cause a load balancer failover to not complete.

Change-Id: Ia46a05ab9fdc97ed9be699e5b2ae90daca3ab9a2
Story: 2008099
Task: 40802
(cherry picked from commit 77dc23fc26cbb8c6488b5205c63bf7cc847a9c32)

commit_message:
Need to have stable implementation of apis

The implementation of method create_port() varies
between plugins and scenario manager.
This patch addresses the same requirement to make
scenario_manager stable

Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable
Signed-off by: Soniya Vyas<svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia743c3a93a0b8e9ffe995db8046047b6e87458c1

commit_message:
Allow kwargs in image_create

As a part of the scenario/manager.py stabilization tracked by
the below BP the patch adds kwargs argument for image_create
method so that the consumers are able to pass additional
parameters if needed.

Change-Id: I484b3e93c25da297703835d146f91f5bcb50626f
Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-01 15:40:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix missing cronie package in RHEL-based image builds

In RHEL-based distros, cron is provided by the cronie package. This package is
missing from the amphora built images.

This patch maps the cron package to cronie for distros in the Red Hat family.

Change-Id: I6fb7889de90e8e5354c1e6ce2c95ec0199ce90e3
Story: 2008351
Task: 41253
(cherry picked from commit 6aa23358eb2f4df412e010fd1fbb9e35ee2e1522)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix missing cronie package in RHEL-based image builds

In RHEL-based distros, cron is provided by the cronie package. This package is
missing from the amphora built images.

This patch maps the cron package to cronie for distros in the Red Hat family.

Change-Id: I6fb7889de90e8e5354c1e6ce2c95ec0199ce90e3
Story: 2008351
Task: 41253
(cherry picked from commit 6aa23358eb2f4df412e010fd1fbb9e35ee2e1522)

commit_message:
Fix create/update_port with python3

unescape_port_kwargs() in api/neutron.py changes a key of dict
during the iteration and it is not allowed in python3.

Change-Id: Ifc1b9a0191aacd32e8c8ecc082b6313f04003f63
Closes-Bug: #1900851
(cherry picked from commit f3927ffb3d5e8803115a436f27d15cf52f61d2e0)

commit_message:
Don't use opendev docker proxy

Look like using docker proxy is slower and less stable than pulling from
dockerhub directly and contributes to some part of unstable builds.

This reverts commit e3f14aaff35364b84acedf53b3778111cbae0373.

Change-Id: I9735ad35ce9240f610479a56eaa38715defa2e04
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

commit_message:
Define condition for the first play host one time

We use the same condition, which defines against what host some "service"
tasks should run against, several times. It's hard to keep it the same
across the role and ansible spending additional resources to evaluate
it each time, so it's simpler and better for the maintenance to set
a boolean variable which will say for all tasks, that we want to run
only against signle host, if they should run or not now.

Change-Id: I4abb67271bd635c8cde5d4d65451e5fa0091868b

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: If9b28505e32616663f63cb11f82307e39f8ee86f

in order to be re-used in osh and osh-addons.

commit_message:
Avoid malformed HTML warning from jquery-migrate

The header template we are serving through ajax is starting with
a newline, which is forbidden in XHTML, and jquery complains about
this.

We need this change to upgrade jquery later.

Change-Id: If0b926b0dcf4c465c4d8ceff1e17ee9a3df1a94b

commit_message:
Map cloud-guest-utils to cloud-utils-growpart for Red Hat distros.

The package cloud-utils-growpart is missing from Red Hat based image
builds which means the root filesystems are not grown on instance
startup which means not much space for things like logs.

This patch maps the cloud-guest-utils package to cloud-utils-growpart.

Change-Id: I3c830a9f0fd21ca10238946721c0f75d01d3ddff
Story: 2008350
Task: 41252
(cherry picked from commit 6d59fec8a0c8011949c547c4f49195c41b9d21a5)

commit_message:
Stop NetworkManager from updating resolv.conf

cloud-init creates /etc/NetworkManager/conf.d/99-cloud-init.conf,
for NetworkManager to not update resolv.conf. However, subsequent
update of NetworkManager seems to remove that file as there is no
config(noreplace) directive for it. So after an update/upgrade of
overcloud nodes, reboot would cleanup the dns entries.

cloud-init do configuration only one time during first instance
boot. So this would ensure resolv.conf is not touched during
subsequent reboots.

Change-Id: I989e3f1d14fd33e97933032111cf48166dc5f50c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-30 14:54:18.000000000', 'message': '[OVS] Remove sleep during polling cycle

OVS agent is a single threaded process with several eventlet threads
listening to RPC messages. We should not give the GIL during the
polling cycle but at the end of it.

This patch removes a sleep introduced in the middle of a OF creation
and forces to have a sleep (even with time 0) at the end of the
polling cycle.

Change-Id: I14a9a212074a450d0e9ffd72dc05906d592542c5
'}, {'created': '2020-11-05 17:51:10.000000000', 'message': '[OVS] Remove sleep during polling cycle

OVS agent is a single threaded process with several eventlet threads
listening to RPC messages. During the polling cycle, the green thread
executing this code should not return or give the execution token to
other thread. Any other thread attending to RPC messages or OVSDB
events will be attended but should be processed at the end of the
cycle.

This patch removes a sleep introduced in the middle of a OF creation
and forces to have a sleep (even with time 0) at the end of the
polling cycle.

Change-Id: I14a9a212074a450d0e9ffd72dc05906d592542c5
'}, {'created': '2020-11-23 12:36:53.000000000', 'message': '[OVS] Remove sleep during polling cycle

OVS agent is a single threaded process with several eventlet threads
listening to RPC messages. During the polling cycle, the green thread
executing this code should not return or give the execution token to
other thread. Any other thread attending to RPC messages or OVSDB
events will be attended but should be processed at the end of the
cycle.

This patch removes a sleep introduced in the middle of a OF creation
and forces to have a sleep (even with time 0) at the end of the
polling cycle.

Related-Bug: #1905271

Change-Id: I14a9a212074a450d0e9ffd72dc05906d592542c5
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS] Remove sleep during polling cycle

OVS agent is a single threaded process with several eventlet threads
listening to RPC messages. During the polling cycle, the green thread
executing this code should not return or give the execution token to
other thread. Any other thread attending to RPC messages or OVSDB
events will be attended but should be processed at the end of the
cycle.

This patch removes a sleep introduced in the middle of a OF creation
and forces to have a sleep (even with time 0) at the end of the
polling cycle.

Related-Bug: #1905271

Change-Id: I14a9a212074a450d0e9ffd72dc05906d592542c5

commit_message:
Cleanup octavia configuration

This drops unused or fully commented out sections out of octavia.conf.
Also we start using service_token_roles as current behavior has been
deprecated a while ago

Change-Id: I1b2fe1cc2c6330e68d1acfa1b50bf732f77e8255

commit_message:
Drop octavia v1 api options

Octavia v1 options have been dropped from upstream on Train. They have
no effect nowadays so no reason to futher carry it's codebase

Change-Id: I1c8f9723ca2ac2b468725c2954adcdaff54dbdf0

(21 comments)

So far so good! I'm starting to understand this spec more. 

I think it's saying we want to add 2 options to the tempest cleanup CLI. 

1. --purge for using a purge_list.json to delete a user defined set of resources 

and 2. --prefix for using the resources_prefix[1] option to query and delete resources associated with that prefix.

Although I was able to understand this from the spec and purge_list implementation[2], I found a number of inconsistencies in the spec and syntax errors I feel should be improved on. Let me know if you want me to expand on any of my comments in-line, thanks.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/tempest/unreleased.html#relnotes-16-0-0-deprecation-notes
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597733/"}, {'account_id': 23625, 'date': '2018-09-18 18:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-09-19 19:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I am really sorry about not reviewing it and responding on queries. 

A permanent solution to this cleanup I am waiting for openstack feature of 'project-level-deletion' which is going to be on openstacksdk side. once we have that we can pass the test-created project id to tempest cleanup and that will automatically cleanup everything. non-project-scope resources can be deleted explicitly which are not so high.

But I am not blocking this solution till we have project-level-deletion ready in openstack. I have few concern of having new target file over existing saved_state file option. commented inline."}, {'account_id': 23625, 'date': '2019-07-31 17:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

In the future when we have a project-level-delete would we want  i different CLI command since the code would just be take list of project and clean all resources?

We still need a way to handle global resource.  Nicolas and I will try on IRC and maybe a new spec to enhance the rand_name tool to support custom prefix."}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-08-07 02:13:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26: -Code-Review

If the community does not need project leak detection tool we can keep thet down stream utility that reads the accounts.yaml file and find leaks.  If no leaks are found the project are deleted. Please let us know if this type of util is not needs with project-level-deletion coming soon.

Also we are thinking that if we could support a uuid in rand_name prefix like rand_name((name, prefix=UUID) then the name would be easy to fine in a concurrent testing environment at project and global level.

Does anyone have any input how we can use the rand_name(name, prefix=) without modifying the py file before each run?"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-08-14 23:14:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

 > queries.
 > >
 > > A permanent solution to this cleanup I am waiting for openstack
 > > feature of 'project-level-deletion' which is going to be on
 > > openstacksdk side. once we have that we can pass the test-created
 > > project id to tempest cleanup and that will automatically cleanup
 > > everything. non-project-scope resources can be deleted explicitly
 > > which are not so high.
 > >
 > > But I am not blocking this solution till we have
 > project-level-deletion
 > > ready in openstack. I have few concern of having new target file
 > > over existing saved_state file option. commented inline.
 > 
 > In the future when we have a project-level-delete would we want  i
 > different CLI command since the code would just be take list of
 > project and clean all resources?
 > 
 > We still need a way to handle global resource.  Nicolas and I will
 > try on IRC and maybe a new spec to enhance the rand_name tool to
 > support custom prefix.

global resource mean? It can be new or exiting CLI but at this point I cannot say anything as project-deletion is not yet ready and not sure how it will be implemented for example error or ignore on missing resource etc. Once we have project-deletion clear pic then we can think of using it in tempest side."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-08-14 23:21:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

> > (3 comments)
 > >
 > > I am really sorry about not reviewing it and responding on
 > queries.
 > >
 > > A permanent solution to this cleanup I am waiting for openstack
 > > feature of 'project-level-deletion' which is going to be on
 > > openstacksdk side. once we have that we can pass the test-created
 > > project id to tempest cleanup and that will automatically cleanup
 > > everything. non-project-scope resources can be deleted explicitly
 > > which are not so high.
 > >
 > > But I am not blocking this solution till we have
 > project-level-deletion
 > > ready in openstack. I have few concern of having new target file
 > > over existing saved_state file option. commented inline.
 > 
 > If the community does not need project leak detection tool we can
 > keep thet down stream utility that reads the accounts.yaml file and
 > find leaks.  If no leaks are found the project are deleted. Please
 > let us know if this type of util is not needs with
 > project-level-deletion coming soon.

Can you elaborate this more? This seems interesting util fo me.

 > 
 > Also we are thinking that if we could support a uuid in rand_name
 > prefix like rand_name((name, prefix=UUID) then the name would be
 > easy to fine in a concurrent testing environment at project and
 > global level.
 > 
 > Does anyone have any input how we can use the rand_name(name,
 > prefix=) without modifying the py file before each run?

Yeah, there is no objection on adding UUID in resource-prefix. Only thing is this solution need py files to modify and make sure every tests use the resource-prefix while creating the resource. But I am not sure how big that will be ? Because most of the tests use data_utils.rand_name() and just adding the resource-prefix-UUID in that method will fix lot of tests. But yes we need audit here."}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-08-15 02:29:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

> > > (3 comments)
 > > >
 > > > I am really sorry about not reviewing it and responding on
 > > queries.
 > > >
 > > > A permanent solution to this cleanup I am waiting for openstack

 > test-created
 > > > project id to tempest cleanup and that will automatically
 > cleanup

 > explicitly
 > > > which are not so high.
 > > >

 > > > ready in openstack. I have few concern of having new target
 > file
 > > > over existing saved_state file option. commented inline.
 > >
 > > If the community does not need project leak detection tool we can
 > > keep thet down stream utility that reads the accounts.yaml file
 > and
 > > find leaks.  If no leaks are found the project are deleted.
 > Please
 > > let us know if this type of util is not needs with
 > > project-level-deletion coming soon.
 > 
 > Can you elaborate this more? This seems interesting util fo me.

We have a set of cliff cli called
account build - that will take a single set of creds and a concurrency count and build an accounts.yaml file (only) with prefix-userid-uuid-seq project and place the creds in the file.  

We have another command callled
account associate - that will build the user (not needed for our LDAP envs) and projects from an accounts.yaml file to get the environment ready for a preprovisioned creds tempest run

Then we have a tool called roomba that will
Take the accounts.yaml and make sure that all project in the accounts.yaml are empty and clean them up.  If they are not empty it will not delete them and our CI has a warn on the run to find the leaks.

We would like to take these tools and adapt them as Openstack QA tools for other to use and improve.  

That is why we have this spec.  Please let us know if any of the above feature are interesting for the Openstack-QA team and we will do a better job of communicating this in a spec.
 > 
 > >
 > > Also we are thinking that if we could support a uuid in rand_name
 > > prefix like rand_name((name, prefix=UUID) then the name would be
 > > easy to fine in a concurrent testing environment at project and
 > > global level.
 > >
 > > Does anyone have any input how we can use the rand_name(name,
 > > prefix=) without modifying the py file before each run?
 > 
 > Yeah, there is no objection on adding UUID in resource-prefix. Only
 > thing is this solution need py files to modify and make sure every
 > tests use the resource-prefix while creating the resource. But I am
 > not sure how big that will be ? Because most of the tests use
 > data_utils.rand_name() and just adding the resource-prefix-UUID in
 > that method will fix lot of tests. But yes we need audit here.

Since you cannot use a conf in the lib directory we are thinking of creating a shell script that just sed the prefix=tempest to what you want and you can run it with a value before the run of your test to something like tempest-uuid so you can grep for project and non-project leaks.
 If we do this would the OpenStack-qa like us to upstream the shell script as a tool?  Otherwise we will keep this as a downstream tool.l"}, {'account_id': 29509, 'date': '2019-08-15 05:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

> Yeah, there is no objection on adding UUID in resource-prefix. 

There is indeed an objection. Please see Anjas and my comments in Patch set 15 for why prefixes are not ok:

"Independently of how tempest `resources_prefix_` is defined, either in tempest.config or randomly chosen prior to tempest run, it may happen, that a productive user chooses exactly the same prefix for his resources by accident. In this case, user's resources will be deleted at tempest cleanup too, which is unacceptable."

and

"Another problem with 'the prefix approach' is that together with the `resources_prefix_` (which has to be long to assure some level of safety/uniquness), the resource name (i.e., prefix + uuid + test class name, etc) might exceed the maximum allowed length for resource names. We already noticed this problem with the current implementation."

Furthermore, Anja also states why project related deletion is not enough:

"... there are resources, that do not have any project_id, such as volume types or flavors. These resources would not be deleted using this approach."

The target file aproach I suggested in Patch set 15 (which is still compatible with the current solution, I believe - requires the notion of both 'saved-state' and target file.) also has the advantage that the tool can be used outside of tempest like so: A user/downstream developer plays around with openstack and realizes after a while that many resources needs to be deleted (Personally, I often find myself in this situation). To do this manually is cumbersome, but he tool would do this with ease: First run it to produce the 'saved state' file (which I think of as an 'existing-state' file), then delete from it the resources you want to keep, and save it as a target file. Run the tool again and you are done.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-08-19 07:19:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

One question on this, how you cleanup the project resources? and does it use python client or direct API call or tempest service client for that ?"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-08-19 07:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

> > Yeah, there is no objection on adding UUID in resource-prefix.

 > There is indeed an objection. Please see Anjas and my comments in

 > either in tempest.config or randomly chosen prior to tempest run,

 > resources will be deleted at tempest cleanup too, which is
 > unacceptable."

 > and

 > of safety/uniquness), the resource name (i.e., prefix + uuid + test

 > The target file aproach I suggested in Patch set 15 (which is still

 > notion of both 'saved-state' and target file.) also has the
 > advantage that the tool can be used outside of tempest like so: A
 > user/downstream developer plays around with openstack and realizes

 > I often find myself in this situation). To do this manually is
 > cumbersome, but he tool would do this with ease: First run it to
 > produce the 'saved state' file (which I think of as an
 > 'existing-state' file), then delete from it the resources you want
 > to keep, and save it as a target file. Run the tool again and you
 > are done.

If we take the resource prefix approach with UUID it would not conflict with any other tempest run. UUID is always unique and we can make a small tool to generate the resource_prefix+UUID which can be configured by user in tempest.conf.
The only challenges I am seeing in this approach is huge amount of work in tests to use the configured resource prefix.

With target file approach I am not getting how it is different than modifying the saved_state file instead of modifying it and creating new file. what is main advantage of creating new file out of saved_state file but not modifying the saved_state file itself and then do cleanup.'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-08-23 01:42:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

> Thanks for more details. This looks good to me. That tool will

> question on this, how you cleanup the project resources? and does
> it use python client or direct API call or tempest service client
> for that ?

Right now we have custom python code that reads the accounts.yaml file that have unique project and if they are empty they will delete the project otherwise it log warning message for the person that wrote the test to clean it up.

We are just want to combine the our direction with the current tempest clean-up direction.'}, {'account_id': 23625, 'date': '2019-08-27 21:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Published edit on patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-11-14 01:02:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Code-Review-1
