I am ok with resource-prefix + UUID approach if you or Nicolas can update the spec. As it need more work. we can get more volunteer to start working on this.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-03 18:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

no activity on this proposal since 9 months. Feel free to restore it once we find volunteer to drive this.'}]

commit_message:
Add a user-isolated cleanup option to tempest cleanup

Allow tempest users to clean up specific resources rather than
having to save a state and then removing everything else.

Reference: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/597733/

Change-Id: Id4d04040e53b9ca56f04485c996917b4c3e452c2

I think this is good start. I have a couple of questions.

1. Are you thinking about to run this test in the gate? (We should, IMO. But it requires a lot of resources, probably.)

2. Do you already have code for this project?
 I feel this is a bit broad like HA, destructive, etc.. So, I think making a Minimum viable product is better to know issues/problem/good points of this spec.'}, {'account_id': 8716, 'date': '2017-06-27 08:17:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Masayuki,
Thank you for the review. 
# sorry for long reply..

(1) Run this on gate?
# Mentioned in #L117
Yes we should. However, there are some concerns;
(a) Testing Duration
(b) Required resources (as you mentioned..)
(c) Technical difficulties
Therefore, I proposed to divide the test scenarios in to 3 groups
and run light weight tests in the gate and offload heavy tests in
to 3rd party CIs. Though, I would love to get more feedback or
suggestions on this.

(2)Do you already have code for this project?
Well, we (Masakari team) implemented part of test scenarios with 
stepler and os-fault [1]. We also have 3rd party CI for Masakari.
 However, currently, there are lot of people doing this in 
there own way. Masakri Team and LCOO [2] are working together
on this topic[3], and currently we are doing gap/overlap analysis
on existing frameworks (in "Alternatives" section).
Aim is to find out what we can reuse, and what we should
re-write to make this framework more feasible.

 Totally agree on start with "minimum viable product".

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:add-stepler-tests-alt
[2] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LCOO
[3] https://openstack-lcoo.atlassian.net/wiki/display/LCOO/Working+Space+for+Exteme+Testing+and+related+topics'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2017-07-12 10:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(9 comments)

Thank you for the spec.

High availability testing is certainly something interesting to consider.
As you mentioned in the spec it may be difficult to run all / many of these tests on OpenStack infrastructure, but it's worth investigating and see if there is something we can integrate in our automated testing infrastructure.

I have a few comments inline. I think it would be nice to be a bit more specific about what services / functionality we're looking to provide, and build a rough priority list of things to be done.

Is there a PoC available or some existing tests - perhaps in a GitHub repo - that we could use as a starting point?"}, {'account_id': 26856, 'date': '2017-09-07 15:37:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Add spec for high availability testing

This spec propose to add new repository with framework to
provide High Availability, destructive, failover, and recovery testing.
This work is originally porposed by Timur[1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/399618/

Partially implements blueprint openstack-dt
Change-Id: I4dcbb2307ebe953f92495db6894f9fe6f6d8d1df

startup which means not much space for things like logs.

This patch maps the cloud-guest-utils package to cloud-utils-growpart.

commit_message:
Map cloud-guest-utils to cloud-utils-growpart for Red Hat distros.

The package cloud-utils-growpart is missing from Red Hat based image
builds which means the root filesystems are not grown on instance
startup which means not much space for things like logs.

This patch maps the cloud-guest-utils package to cloud-utils-growpart.

Change-Id: I3c830a9f0fd21ca10238946721c0f75d01d3ddff
Story: 2008350
Task: 41252
(cherry picked from commit 6d59fec8a0c8011949c547c4f49195c41b9d21a5)

commit_message:
Release oslo.context for wallaby-1 milestone

This is a library release for oslo.context for the wallaby-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

Change-Id: I37e349ed9b3647a1d8ee1df4ec8dec341f438bc7

messages:
[{'account_id': 16465, 'date': '2020-04-23 16:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-24 15:28:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FYI the way we currently represent that is using "depends on" and "see also" in the project navigator at https://www.openstack.org/software/project-navigator/openstack-components

Like compare Nova (https://www.openstack.org/software/releases/train/components/nova) which has depends with Ironic (https://www.openstack.org/software/releases/train/components/ironic) which only has "see also".

I personally find that more readable than a tag on that page... Also that would end up duplicating information ?'}, {'account_id': 16465, 'date': '2020-04-24 16:29:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> FYI the way we currently represent that is using "depends on" and
 > "see also" in the project navigator at https://www.openstack.org/software/project-navigator/openstack-components
 > 
 > Like compare Nova (https://www.openstack.org/software/releases/train/components/nova)
 > which has depends with Ironic (https://www.openstack.org/software/releases/train/components/ironic)
 > which only has "see also".
 > 
 > I personally find that more readable than a tag on that page...
 > Also that would end up duplicating information ?

TIL. Thanks for that Thierry. I must admit I haven't visited the openstack.org website in forever, so I wasn't aware of this :)

How are the dependencies for each project calculated?

It does also seem that that page also does show some of the tags that a project has, but not other.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-04-28 07:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I love the idea, I have questions on the execution.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-30 06:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > FYI the way we currently represent that is using "depends on" and
 > > "see also" in the project navigator at https://www.openstack.org/software/project-navigator/openstack-components
 > >
 > > Like compare Nova (https://www.openstack.org/software/releases/train/components/nova)
 > > which has depends with Ironic (https://www.openstack.org/software/releases/train/components/ironic)
 > > which only has "see also".
 > >
 > > I personally find that more readable than a tag on that page...
 > > Also that would end up duplicating information ?
 > 
 > TIL. Thanks for that Thierry. I must admit I haven't visited the
 > openstack.org website in forever, so I wasn't aware of this :)
 > 
> How are the dependencies for each project calculated?

It's provided by the project team, at https://opendev.org/osf/openstack-map/src/branch/master/openstack_components.yaml

> It does also seem that that page also does show some of the tags
> that a project has, but not other.

Yes, only a selection of tags has been deemed relevant for a product marketing website. Let me know if you feel like others should be included.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-05-07 11:26:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > > FYI the way we currently represent that is using "depends on"
 > and
 > > > "see also" in the project navigator at https://www.openstack.org/software/project-navigator/openstack-components
 > > >
 > > > Like compare Nova (https://www.openstack.org/software/releases/train/components/nova)
 > > > which has depends with Ironic (https://www.openstack.org/software/releases/train/components/ironic)
 > > > which only has "see also".
 > > >
 > > > I personally find that more readable than a tag on that page...
 > > > Also that would end up duplicating information ?
 > >
 > > TIL. Thanks for that Thierry. I must admit I haven't visited the
 > > openstack.org website in forever, so I wasn't aware of this :)
 > >
 > > How are the dependencies for each project calculated?
 > 
 > It's provided by the project team, at https://opendev.org/osf/openstack-map/src/branch/master/openstack_components.yaml
 > 
 > > It does also seem that that page also does show some of the tags
 > > that a project has, but not other.
 > 
 > Yes, only a selection of tags has been deemed relevant for a
 > product marketing website. Let me know if you feel like others
 > should be included.

I think standlone should stand out. I like the concept of this proposal.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-05-07 13:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from tag-supports-standalone to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2020-06-22 17:37:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1 Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I support adding this.  There are some wording things that need to be addressed.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2020-06-22 18:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Not -1 on the idea but support clarifying what standalone is going to mean and disagree with the Dockerfile requirement.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2020-06-22 19:14:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

(1 comment)

Looks like an excellent idea to me. Obviously needs a little more work still, but I think its a good addition :)'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2020-06-22 19:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Rollcall-Vote Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2020-06-22 19:14:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2020-06-23 14:58:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I wonder if there is room in the definition to explain the "how" of operating services independently? for example ironic+metalsmith, ironic+bifrost, cinder+cinderlib ...what I'm trying to say is that often operating independently means operating *differently*, too.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-06-23 16:03:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Thanks Kristi for this, nice idea. I think we need to work on the definition of standalone and how to verify that. otherwise it will be good to have tag for such information. and openstack-map also is the things we should be making sure is all aligned with what we will be tagging. It should not happen that we tag any projects as standalone here and openstack-map say it has dependencies. We need some process to define the sync between these two with market team.'}, {'account_id': 16465, 'date': '2020-06-24 15:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)

Thank you for the great feedback.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2020-07-29 10:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Personally, I still think OpenStack is an integration of different services, relying on each other, complementing each other. OpenStack services are able to be running independently, but that shouldn't be recommended, that's harmful to the entire ecosystem.

If most of the services declare themselves to be 'standalone', what's the value of 'OpenStack'?"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-08-05 13:22:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Personally, I still think OpenStack is an integration of different
 > services, relying on each other, complementing each other.
 > OpenStack services are able to be running independently, but that
 > shouldn't be recommended, that's harmful to the entire ecosystem.
 > 
 > If most of the services declare themselves to be 'standalone',
 > what's the value of 'OpenStack'?

I believe it's quite the opposite. Many of those software should be standalone, and have their own merits. However, they are even stronger together, and that's OpenStack. But maybe I am dreaming there :)"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-08-05 13:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add assert:supports-standalone

This proposes the addition of a tag for documenting projects which
can be run standalone.

This idea was first mentioned by Jeremy Freudberg in
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/013821.html

Change-Id: I5276d20027cc0ad2ff080290e932c58c248bd405

commit_message:
Release pycadf for wallaby-1 milestone

This is a library release for pycadf for the wallaby-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

Change-Id: I9afed85a7063ca3b36923fdda78467363284febb

commit_message:
Ensure the correct SELinux context for /httpboot and /tftpboot

The sefcontext module does not modify existing files, so we need
to run restorecon. This, in turn, makes the custom ironic policy
unnecessary.

Also fixes the ownership of the checksums file.

Change-Id: Ie97d0af286e11bfd0459a1dca0171eff5afa77bc

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: Ib833cd6818e7071cf3e85f77966e9c02a4026efd

commit_message:
Fix missing cronie package in RHEL-based image builds

In RHEL-based distros, cron is provided by the cronie package. This package is
missing from the amphora built images.

This patch maps the cron package to cronie for distros in the Red Hat family.

Change-Id: I6fb7889de90e8e5354c1e6ce2c95ec0199ce90e3
Story: 2008351
Task: 41253
(cherry picked from commit 6aa23358eb2f4df412e010fd1fbb9e35ee2e1522)

commit_message:
Remove assert_supports-zero-downtime-upgrade tag

As discussed in Wallaby PTG[1], this tag does not have
testing framework available at upstream and also none of the
project has this tag. Let's remove this tag for now and if in future
it can be reproposed if situation improve in term of testing and
project side interests.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-wallaby-ptg

Change-Id: Id4902f4f980e74d03080f0f093edac329c060b2a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-23 14:12:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix load balancers with failed amphora failover

This patch is a complement of [1] which we ensure
a fresh lb object, but only for AmpListenersUpdate
class.

It was observed, at least on train and ussuri
deployments that multiple failed amphoras were still
happening when using session persistence.

That is fixed and failover works flawless with session
persistence when we also ensure a fresh lb object on
AmphoraIndexListenerUpdate class.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/756597/

Change-Id: I923accd73e0c9cadc91c115157c576432f428622
Story: 2008099
Task: 40802
(cherry picked from commit f96251c74275ac44a8ac20ff23a0f6c850af44f5)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix load balancers with failed amphora failover

This patch is a complement of [1] which we ensure
a fresh lb object, but only for AmpListenersUpdate
class.

It was observed, at least on train and ussuri
deployments that multiple failed amphoras were still
happening when using session persistence.

That is fixed and failover works flawless with session
persistence when we also ensure a fresh lb object on
AmphoraIndexListenerUpdate class.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/756597/

Change-Id: I923accd73e0c9cadc91c115157c576432f428622
Story: 2008099
Task: 40802
(cherry picked from commit f96251c74275ac44a8ac20ff23a0f6c850af44f5)

commit_message:
[Container build] raise Exception post logging error

Currently it catches SystemError and log error message
but do not fail, raise SystemError so it fails too.

Closes-Bug: #1905348
Change-Id: I2e823c58779dba529a58aff5e0e1c0c880c267aa
(cherry picked from commit 2c7f7d6e610b47a1ce205e23839f023877a1a774)

commit_message:
Add CinderBackupOptVolumes parameter

This adds a new parameter 'CinderBackupOptVolumes' to allow
cinder-backup to mount extra volumes.

Change-Id: Ide6d464be4a13457debfeceb61e5255c06b67808
(cherry picked from commit 3f8decf175fe79223b78d2153c752a6f368a2275)

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-04-16 04:49:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I love the idea, I'm a little concerned about data storage and the lack of details about how we'll actually leverage this in the code. What we will call, other than the DB object structure."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-04-16 08:35:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(6 comments)

> I love the idea, I'm a little concerned about data storage and the
 > lack of details about how we'll actually leverage this in the code.
 > What we will call, other than the DB object structure.

Thanks Julia for the review! this spec only covers power synchronization events (at this time), it provides a base for other events so we can iterate from here. I could expand the range, as long as it wouldn't be too much. To do so, we could use a little helper for places where last_error is set/cleared, we just indicate whether the event needs a log."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-04-16 08:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-04-16 10:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-04-23 09:52:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Thanks Dmitry for your thoughts, I think I'd need to figure out a way to have lesser impact on the data amount, but still useful in practice.
But this feature has no intention to substitute logs scattered in hosts. Collecting log files in hosts sounds like a ELK thing, which is definitely suitable for 3rd party solutions."}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2019-05-02 09:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Kaifeng, the spec is missing details about how the history table is populated. Many questions here:
- When an entry is made in the table?
- How is it decided if an error is relevant to be logged in the table?
- Is there a limit of logs saved per node? Can we end up logging the same error multiple times? Eg: retries contacting an OpenStack service.

Can you please the details?'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2020-06-11 15:40:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey folks, sorry for the long silence on this spec.
A year after and then I review on my past experience standing from the view point of an operator, I feel it's a pain for digging logs to identify what the real problem is :(
I think it would be very (I believe so) useful to have an API support for users/operators to retrieve more on the errors as well as node actions, we don't want to inflate our database but at least let's provide some useful context instead of the solely last_error field, which can be easily overwritten.
I will find a time to do a revision."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-06-16 19:47:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Hey folks, sorry for the long silence on this spec.
 > A year after and then I review on my past experience standing from

 > to identify what the real problem is :(
 > I think it would be very (I believe so) useful to have an API
 > support for users/operators to retrieve more on the errors as well
 > as node actions, we don't want to inflate our database but at least
 > let's provide some useful context instead of the solely last_error
 > field, which can be easily overwritten.
 > I will find a time to do a revision.

I totally agree, something is better than nothing, and right now we offer basically nothing back. :(

Let us know how we can help and I guess see if we can get some review traffic. If you'd like there to be a thread or discussion during a meeting, just let me know!"}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-06-23 08:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-16 02:02:18.000000000', 'message': 'Support error log history

Currently ironic uses one last_error field to record error information
when something goes wrong. Sometimes, an error is caused by another
error within a single operation, we even have the case the root cause
could be overwritten alone the code path, care must be taken to prevent
last_error from being overwritten which make things complicated, it
would be easier with error log history.

On the other hand, an error history reflects node status during a
period of time, it helps to monitor or diagnose the node, especially
we now have some fault autorecovery mechanism like power fault recovery.

The proposal is to introduce a new table named errors, and record
node failure events that make sense.

Change-Id: I3b8832a945183ce3ed41ea79838fc9f682bfc547
Story: 2002980
Task: 22989
'}, {'created': '2020-06-28 06:51:50.000000000', 'message': "Support node history

Currently ironic uses one last_error field to record error information
when an operation failed. The field is easily overwritten and we don't
have a traceback on what happened in the past, the only way is to check
service logs.

The proposal is to introduce a new table named node_history, and record
important node events that helps bare metal maintenance and troubleshooting.

Change-Id: I3b8832a945183ce3ed41ea79838fc9f682bfc547
Story: 2002980
Task: 22989
"}, {'created': '2020-08-19 12:33:45.000000000', 'message': "Support node history

Currently ironic uses one last_error field to record error information
when an operation failed. The field is easily overwritten and we don't
have a traceback on what happened in the past, the only way is to check
service logs.

The proposal is to introduce a new table named node_history, and record
important node events that helps bare metal maintenance and troubleshooting.

Change-Id: I3b8832a945183ce3ed41ea79838fc9f682bfc547
Story: 2002980
Task: 22989
"}, {'created': '2020-11-24 11:15:33.000000000', 'message': "Support node history

Currently ironic uses one last_error field to record error information
when an operation failed. The field is easily overwritten and we don't
have a traceback on what happened in the past, the only way is to check
service logs.

The proposal is to introduce a new table named node_history, and record
important node events that helps bare metal maintenance and troubleshooting.

Change-Id: I3b8832a945183ce3ed41ea79838fc9f682bfc547

"}]
commit_message:
Support node history

Currently ironic uses one last_error field to record error information
when an operation failed. The field is easily overwritten and we don't
have a traceback on what happened in the past, the only way is to check
service logs.

The proposal is to introduce a new table named node_history, and record
important node events that helps bare metal maintenance and troubleshooting.

Change-Id: I3b8832a945183ce3ed41ea79838fc9f682bfc547
Story: 2002980
Task: 22989

messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-11-26 01:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-11-30 10:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-12-01 20:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The proposed patches so far have merged, but there are quite a few openstack/* repos that are still using the third party mock:

https://codesearch.opendev.org/?q=%5Efrom%20mock

It might be worth keeping this around until that work is completed.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-12-01 20:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> The proposed patches so far have merged, but there are quite a few openstack/* repos that are still using the third party mock:
> 
> https://codesearch.opendev.org/?q=%5Efrom%20mock
> 
> It might be worth keeping this around until that work is completed.

It seems like only two projects and 3 repo left in openstack and most of them patches are already up - https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22unittest.mock%22+status:open

- openstack Swift
- openstack Charm

three repo:
openstack / networking-sfc
openstack / freezer-dr
openstack / ansible-collections-openstack'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2020-12-03 13:56:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

Good cleanup.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-12-03 15:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Missing supported_os fact

If the supported_os fact is missing, the test will not run on the
default supported systems (debian, ubuntu, centos).

Change-Id: Ifaa3da741778f3f2af00e82934235f44dd0cf24e

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

'}]
commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: I1e1e39f39c6b0bb957d48d0f9a6cf7753a8d1258

commit_message:
Fix volume rekey during clone

Apply the correct encryption key to the
new volume during clone.

Closes-Bug: #1904440
Change-Id: I8c2c58092da4d5801642036a96079da45eafb290
(cherry picked from commit 25cded9d106ea3c4d23b87d594451dc7fb9e0484)

subject: Implement secure RBAC for address scopes
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-03 02:45:16.000000000', 'message': 'Implement secure RBAC for address scopes

This commit updates the policies for address scopes to account for
system-scope and default roles provided in keystone. This is part of a
broader set of changes across OpenStack APIs to provide a more secure
and consistent authorization experience for end-users and operators.

Change-Id: I693c03622b047f126b5031a01f7f7ebbb002b22e
'}]
commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for address scopes

This commit updates the policies for address scopes to account for
system-scope and default roles provided in keystone. This is part of a
broader set of changes across OpenStack APIs to provide a more secure
and consistent authorization experience for end-users and operators.

Change-Id: I693c03622b047f126b5031a01f7f7ebbb002b22e

commit_message:
Decrease amphora image RAM for CI

Default value for amphora image is 1024MB which is the way too much for
CI gates that overall has 8Gb of RAM. We also limit threads number for
octavia health manager.

Change-Id: Ib18788ffc318b43d78e154295d027f9ed0dccf38

[{'created': '2020-11-18 13:22:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add Zun CI requirement to Zuul required projects

repo currently fails in Zun CI

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: I9a48a44a1cc32c3ab9393b97ea9014dc95cfd4de

commit_message:
Allow bespoke get_charm_instance method to be used

Allow a charm to use the new register_get_charm_instance decorator
to register the method to be used when getting a charm instance.
Currently get_charm_instance expects standard OpenStack
versioning, this change allows are a charm to register an
alternative get_charm_instance method that can handle an
alternative versioning system.

Perhaps controversially the default method is not defined in
charms_openstack.charm.defaults. I have kept it in core
because it felt a more natural fit there given it relies on
core._releases but I am open to moving it if that is
preferable.

Change-Id: I42574654bc1f314b49049e80861d4039f8484dff

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-30 11:59:17.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce number of processes on small systems

Even the most modest 4C/8T system would run with the maximum 16 processes
due to the calculation being VCPU*2.

We devide amount of CPUs to number of threads for hyperthreaded CPUs

Change-Id: Ie4384375f65d6ec262a3f5b71ab7cd62ed5e210a
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce number of processes on small systems

Even the most modest 4C/8T system would run with the maximum 16 processes
due to the calculation being VCPU*2.

We devide amount of CPUs to number of threads for hyperthreaded CPUs

Change-Id: Ie4384375f65d6ec262a3f5b71ab7cd62ed5e210a

commit_message:
Add support for python 3.8

Introduce support of python 3.8 [1] and move tox and jobs to py38.

jsonschema 3.2.0 [2] support python 3.8
pyOpenSSL 19.1.0 [3] support python 3.8

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria
[2] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[3] https://pypi.org/project/pyOpenSSL/19.1.0/

Change-Id: I8f561325780a95173501f42e10b6fce617bb17f4

use HTTPStatus instead of http.client

We don't need an HTTP client for this, we only
need status codes.  Just load that instead.

https://docs.python.org/3/library/http.html

commit_message:
Define condition for the first play host one time

We use the same condition, which defines against what host some "service"
tasks should run against, several times. It's hard to keep it the same
across the role and ansible spending additional resources to evaluate
it each time, so it's simpler and better for the maintenance to set
a boolean variable which will say for all tasks, that we want to run
only against signle host, if they should run or not now.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/756310
Change-Id: I41d331fdb5ee95e0c9b9edbb3c7ee19ccd40d98c

commit_message:
Fix `ProblemDetails.detail` from `.details`

Field name `details` is used in ProblemDetails Object, but
it should be `detail`. This field missmatch cause
NotImplemntError when failing to instantiate VNF.

This patch fixes the filed 'details' to 'detail' in
ProblemDetails Object.

Closes-Bug: 1905680
Change-Id: I71b333dc05f2195dacb478f3f0bc442dac9c5691

commit_message:
Modify 2ctlr for multiple overclouds ci job 

2ctlr nodes is currently not utilized by any ci job[1], With this patch
we are modifying 2ctlr for a new ci job which test multiple overcloud 
stacks deployment using a single undercloud.

control_0 will be utilized by first overcloud stack and control_1 will
be utilized by second overcloud stack.

[1] https://codesearch.opendev.org/?q=2ctlr&i=nope&files=&excludeFiles=&repos=

Change-Id: I04100ba2c3cee861aaebda5121375f34242c8e92

commit_message:
Adding Ceph Dashboard to the Edge roles

This change adds the CephGrafana Service for the
Edge roles.
Also, a new DistributedComputeHCIDashboard is
introduced: the purpose of this role is to support
the StorageDashboard network on the edge site when
that network is defined and used in central site.

Change-Id: I973e1364e5f3d0e03658acdd37e316a59504825e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-20 13:28:54.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh ceph-ansible group_vars values

The purpose of this change is having a mechanism to refresh the
ceph-ansible group_vars/ when a Ceph related service, that defines a
specific set of variables, is included in the overcloud.

For this reason, this patch:

1. Adds the "prepare" tasks (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) at the
   beginning of Step2. By doing this we can make sure that all the
   variables needed by ceph-ansible are properly collected at Step1,
   and persisted (in group_vars/*) at Step2, before the ceph-ansible
   playbook execution.
   This approach is valid for all the services that define additional
   ConfigOverrides variables

2. Removes the "prepare" (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) in the rgw
   service: having the "prepare" tasks included "per role" creates the
   risk of executing it multiple times.
   For example, including "prepare" in clients and rgw results in three
   execution of the same thing!
   Adding it at the beginning of Step 2 ensures that it's executed at
   least two times.

Change-Id: If81477ad2c6048b7103810e519083a0870897fa3
(cherry picked from commit 1fafca733c995dc835cbe040c12d766e8ac02cd4)
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh ceph-ansible group_vars values

The purpose of this change is having a mechanism to refresh the
ceph-ansible group_vars/ when a Ceph related service, that defines a
specific set of variables, is included in the overcloud.

For this reason, this patch:

1. Adds the "prepare" tasks (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) at the
   beginning of Step2. By doing this we can make sure that all the
   variables needed by ceph-ansible are properly collected at Step1,
   and persisted (in group_vars/*) at Step2, before the ceph-ansible
   playbook execution.
   This approach is valid for all the services that define additional
   ConfigOverrides variables

2. Removes the "prepare" (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) in the rgw
   service: having the "prepare" tasks included "per role" creates the
   risk of executing it multiple times.
   For example, including "prepare" in clients and rgw results in three
   execution of the same thing!
   Adding it at the beginning of Step 2 ensures that it's executed at
   least two times.

Change-Id: If81477ad2c6048b7103810e519083a0870897fa3
(cherry picked from commit 1fafca733c995dc835cbe040c12d766e8ac02cd4)

improper redirect to details page opened in a new tab.

Closes-Bug: #1905707

messages:

When offload nic is set for the tenant network, nova-migration-target healthcheck fails, but running it again continues well and completes it without any further issues. '}, {'created': '2020-11-18 08:54:14.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: OvS HW Offload support with FFU with leapp

On leapp upgrade (7 to 8), the os-net-config package
will not be present initiall on rhel8, which contins the
executable os-net-config-sriov. This executable is used
by sriov_config.service on each reboot to configure the
VFs and switchdev mode based on stored configuration.
Since this executable is not available, sriov_config
service will fail to setup VFs.

Remove the sriov_config service explicitly

Change-Id: I354bb6a13ac4d53c75aa22a39b1977a0074466ad
'}, {'created': '2020-11-25 08:40:51.000000000', 'message': 'OvS HW Offload support for FFU with leapp

On leapp upgrade (7 to 8), the os-net-config package
will not be present initiall on rhel8, which contains the
executable os-net-config-sriov. This executable is used
by sriov_config.service on each reboot to configure the
VFs and switchdev mode based on stored configuration.
Since this executable is not available, sriov_config
service will fail to setup VFs.

Remove sriov_config service explicitly as it will fail
on reboot and remove all the VFs (as leapp will fail
if upgraded with VF). This tasks will be performed
before starting leapp upgrade and after upgrade
os-net-config run (with --no-activate) will configure
the service and VFs as per the existing configuration.

Change-Id: I354bb6a13ac4d53c75aa22a39b1977a0074466ad
'}]
commit_message:
OvS HW Offload support for FFU with leapp

On leapp upgrade (7 to 8), the os-net-config package
will not be present initiall on rhel8, which contains the
executable os-net-config-sriov. This executable is used
by sriov_config.service on each reboot to configure the
VFs and switchdev mode based on stored configuration.
Since this executable is not available, sriov_config
service will fail to setup VFs.

Remove sriov_config service explicitly as it will fail
on reboot and remove all the VFs (as leapp will fail
if upgraded with VF). This tasks will be performed
before starting leapp upgrade and after upgrade
os-net-config run (with --no-activate) will configure
the service and VFs as per the existing configuration.

Change-Id: I354bb6a13ac4d53c75aa22a39b1977a0074466ad

commit_message:
Separate pkg version collection from release calc

Break out the collection of a packages version information from
deriving the corresponding OpenStack release. This allows the package
version code to be used with charms which have their own
idiosyncratic versioning system.

Change-Id: I9a7dcc6ad3da8860dc650f956e5c6eec8ff51660

commit_message:
Add urllib3's SSLError to expected Watcher exc

Seems like new requests lib is somehow raising
urllib3.exceptions.SSLError more often. This commit adds it to the
exceptions expected by the Watcher and silenced with a retry.

Closes-Bug: 1906498
Change-Id: I214c08c197483c00a5caecc47ef117cdd07a7652

commit_message:
Skip unscheduled pods when deleting NPs

It may happen that there's an unscheduled pod matching a policy when NP
is getting deleted. In that case we'll get a traceback as pod has no
nodeName set. This commit fixes that by making sure we skip unscheduled
pods when detaching SGs from ports on NP deletion.

Change-Id: I5b712ba97e030192d1d24cce2585724a78408e23
Closes-Bug: 1904040

subject: Add support for python 3.8
messages:
[{'account_id': 32029, 'date': '2020-12-03 01:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-12-03 08:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

According to https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria (which is the latest stable version, not the current master btw), the supported versions of Python are:
3.6, 3.7, and 3.8
pyOpenSSL 17.1.0 supports Python 3.6 [1], therefore it gets to be in lower-constraints as the minimum version needed to run ironicclient.
lower-constraints purpose may be a bit misleading, I suggest you to review https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/dependency-management.html

[1] https://pypi.org/project/pyOpenSSL/17.1.0/'}, {'account_id': 32029, 'date': '2020-12-03 09:15:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-03 01:34:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for python 3.8

Introduce support of python 3.8 [1] and move tox and jobs to py38.

pyOpenSSL 19.1.0 [2] support python 3.8

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria
[2] https://pypi.org/project/pyOpenSSL/19.1.0/

Change-Id: I5ad491575145af8f249c3b3d9fea6c1843b8a8b4
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for python 3.8

Introduce support of python 3.8 [1] and move tox and jobs to py38.

pyOpenSSL 19.1.0 [2] support python 3.8

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria
[2] https://pypi.org/project/pyOpenSSL/19.1.0/

Change-Id: I5ad491575145af8f249c3b3d9fea6c1843b8a8b4

messages:
[{'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2020-08-05 13:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-09-08 15:23:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is not valid for backport. This changes the API interface of the library and is not appropriate for stable branches.'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2020-09-10 05:55:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This is not valid for backport. This changes the API interface of

but the latest stable branch (Ussuri) can not work properly due to os_tenant_name. should we fix it ?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-09-10 12:20:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > This is not valid for backport. This changes the API interface of
 > > the library and is not appropriate for stable branches.

Can you explain how ussuri stopped working? It had been working so far, so if something changed, that would seem to indicate something else was backported that shouldn't have been."}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2020-12-03 08:45:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Remove keystone v2 related code

Kyestone V2 support was removed in Train, so it's safe to remove "tenant" param.

Change-Id: I1458a61f5b0d70e1d4ebe3b8ba88bc4826b7a363
(cherry picked from commit 0df8a1da22145b06c30234b9f289d0ce55dd12f8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-21 18:23:05.000000000', 'message': "Switch deploy steps to tripleo_free

The tripleo_free strategy should allow the tasks to run freely for a
given playbook that defines using the tripleo_free strategy. The defaul
strategy is a linear one that will execute each task across all servers
prior to moving to the next task. The tripleo_free strategy will execute
the tasks on servers without syncryonizing the tasks within a given
playbook. Because TripleO uses step concepts in our deployment, we
already have the syncronization points in the main playbook. The outer
playbook should be done linearly but the deployment steps themselves
should be done freely.

The tripleo_free playbook won't stop execution on all hosts if one host
fails or becomes unreachable. It will however end the play exeuction if
any error occurs on any host. This is similar to the deployment failures
we used to have with Heat where a failure on any single node would stop
the deployment at a given deployment step.  A future improvement of this
will be to add logic to handle a failure percentage on a given TripleO
role to only stop the playbook if the failure percentage exceeds a
defined amount. Currently any failure will stop a playbook but may not
stop later tasks from executing on the rest of the hosts. We will likely
need to implement a tripleo_linear strategy based on the upstream linear
strategy to understand these failure percentages as well.

NOTE: During the testing of this, we identified two issues with the free
strategy in ansible itself. We will need those fixes landed in the
version of ansible prior to being able to land this.

Depends-On: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/69730
Depends-On: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/69524
Change-Id: Ib4a02a192377aafab5970647d74977cb1189bcae
(cherry picked from commit a5f9740759461434177d6590cc8c99bb5e48365b)

commit_message:
Switch deploy steps to tripleo_free

The tripleo_free strategy should allow the tasks to run freely for a
given playbook that defines using the tripleo_free strategy. The defaul
strategy is a linear one that will execute each task across all servers
prior to moving to the next task. The tripleo_free strategy will execute
the tasks on servers without syncryonizing the tasks within a given
playbook. Because TripleO uses step concepts in our deployment, we
already have the syncronization points in the main playbook. The outer
playbook should be done linearly but the deployment steps themselves
should be done freely.

The tripleo_free playbook won't stop execution on all hosts if one host
fails or becomes unreachable. It will however end the play exeuction if
any error occurs on any host. This is similar to the deployment failures
we used to have with Heat where a failure on any single node would stop
the deployment at a given deployment step.  A future improvement of this
will be to add logic to handle a failure percentage on a given TripleO
role to only stop the playbook if the failure percentage exceeds a
defined amount. Currently any failure will stop a playbook but may not
stop later tasks from executing on the rest of the hosts. We will likely
need to implement a tripleo_linear strategy based on the upstream linear
strategy to understand these failure percentages as well.

NOTE: During the testing of this, we identified two issues with the free
strategy in ansible itself. We will need those fixes landed in the
version of ansible prior to being able to land this.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/739578/
Change-Id: Ib4a02a192377aafab5970647d74977cb1189bcae
(cherry picked from commit a5f9740759461434177d6590cc8c99bb5e48365b)

commit_message:
Add NovaDisableImageDownloadToRbd parameter

This exposes the nova workaround to disable downloading images from glance to
rbd (vs a cheap COW clone) when nova-compute and glance are not backed by the
same ceph cluster.

Related nova change: I069b6b1d28eaf1eee5c7fb8d0fdef9c0c229a1bf
Depends-On: I8329810d6c047c0d94e7b123e7cdc1263a7856cd

Change-Id: Ib5478e53eb1f216bf6924ff30ea8502cb8529d00
(cherry picked from commit b756944d454299ad908bddd0fe2ba679c166ec6e)

commit_message:
Add amphora_id in store params for failover_amphora

Several tasks require amphora_id parameter to be passed in
get_amphora_for_lb_failover_subflow.
Execution passed results in error:

taskflow.exceptions.NotFound: Mapped argument 'amphora_id' <=
'amphora_id' was not produced by any accessible provider
(1 possible providers were scanned).

Also fix getting ID parameter from amphora dict in
AmphoraIndexListenersReload and add missing retries for create_*
resources in v2 worker.

Change-Id: I5ed6288b2776bd7f1c9b67e9cfd9a8f05b1196be

[{'created': '2020-12-02 21:58:07.000000000', 'message': 'Remove restart_command config option

In real life, nothin actually uses that config option. We currently
support nova-compute and libvirt as services, and both only use
start_command and stop_command. Libvirt only uses those because it
needs to be a stopped for a destructive test, and nova-compute only
uses those because it implements restart() as a sequence of stop/start
operations and waits for the service to appear down/up in the services
API at each step.

This patch removes the restart_command config option entirely, and
moves the stop()/start() implementation of restart() into the base
ServiceManager class.

If we ever actually need to restart a service, we can re-add this
config option in the future.

Change-Id: I14dddb5846b2330811c496aa7c134d020781edb8

commit_message:
Remove restart_command config option

In real life, nothing actually uses that config option. We currently
support nova-compute and libvirt as services, and both only use
start_command and stop_command. Libvirt only uses those because it
needs to be stopped for a destructive test, and nova-compute only
uses those because it implements restart() as a sequence of stop/start
operations and waits for the service to appear down/up in the services
API at each step.

This patch removes the restart_command config option entirely, and
moves the stop()/start() implementation of restart() into the base
ServiceManager class.

If we ever actually need to restart a service, we can re-add this
config option in the future.

Change-Id: I14dddb5846b2330811c496aa7c134d020781edb8

commit_message:
Disable not used services in the tempest and rally jobs

We don't need to run Swift, Cinder and etcd services in the
Neutron jobs so this patch disables those services on all
such jobs defined in the Neutron repository.
It will skip some tests which aren't really related to Neutron
and will safe some resources on test nodes.

This patch also enables br-ex-tcpdump and br-int-flows services
in the jobs where it was missing.
It may be useful during debugging some failures of those jobs
in the future.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/762622

Change-Id: I0db516b184cf621e4539d11726fe1bd47b53ba05

commit_message:
Add NovaApiMaxLimit configure max_limit for nova

Currently, we can't set Nova [api]/max_limit
using a supplied Heat parameter. This change
adds a Heat parameter that will make it easier
for users to configure max_limit in nova.conf.

Change-Id: I4c28c6c90c52f22d4fa81d13e85842ce876ec2b9
closes-bug: 1904096

commit_message:
repair the HealthMonitor operating_status

When the loadbalancer and its subcomponents are successfully created,
the HealthMonitor operator_status is OFFLINE.
I know this is a wrong solution, but I can not find where to deal with it.

Change-Id: Ic72459dbfe66c86b865526ad239f95d1b1984bc4

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-03 02:25:12.000000000', 'message': "Bump minimum versions of libraries for secure RBAC

In order to support more consistent and secure RBAC defaults, we're
proposing common personas across OpenStack projects for secure RBAC.
These personas fulfill the most common usecases for custom policy
requests in OpenStack deployments, while making the code more consistent
across OpenStack, easier to understand, easier to maintain, and easier
to modify.

This commit bumps the minimum requirements needed for libraries to
understand enhanced scope checks. Subsequent patches leverage these
libraries in updated policies.

Change-Id: I53cf2cb73b6569c3eccc7cf6bb14b6711f5b5ef9
"}]
commit_message:
Bump minimum versions of libraries for secure RBAC

In order to support more consistent and secure RBAC defaults, we're
proposing common personas across OpenStack projects for secure RBAC.
These personas fulfill the most common usecases for custom policy
requests in OpenStack deployments, while making the code more consistent
across OpenStack, easier to understand, easier to maintain, and easier
to modify.

This commit bumps the minimum requirements needed for libraries to
understand enhanced scope checks. Subsequent patches leverage these
libraries in updated policies.

Change-Id: I53cf2cb73b6569c3eccc7cf6bb14b6711f5b5ef9

commit_message:
Change help string to use openstack instead of neutron

The openstack version of 'neutron ext-list' is
'openstack extension list --network', changed the help
string accordingly.  Also changed some minor grammar
issues in the network section.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: I30e5446b4afe33d8b60a50813d590c0a91649ad2

commit_message:
Add choices to `--type` command line argument

We only allow `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones. Instead of testing for
either one of those two choices later in the code, we can offload this
test to the parser.

Change-Id: I8244e13303646e6686e4233e1edbd2bbc788e054
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add support for python 3.8

Introduce support of python 3.8 [1] and move tox and jobs to py38.
pyopenssl 19.1.0 [2] support python 3.8

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria
[2] https://pypi.org/project/pyOpenSSL/19.1.0/

Change-Id: I4ead112d337d393034db1f080938a8d4942e2d73

commit_message:
Add documentation about login with federation

The documentation presents the parameters necessary
to authenticate via federation (using password) and do
a brief description of each parameter used in the process.

Change-Id: Iae3b6d0b56ebd2bbbb94f9f3637b5086e75559a7

commit_message:
Remove 'admin_role' option

This option was deprecated in the Ussuri release by change
I0f61f85a0aaa4f68e345fa08fbb6b039d3d32587 and it is now eligible
for removal following the standard OpenStack deprecation policy.

[{'created': '2020-10-09 09:14:15.000000000', 'message': 'PowerMax Driver - Safeguarding retype to some in-use replicated modes

Host assisted migration is a better option for retyping from a non-replicated
to a replicated (Asynchronous and Metro) modes.

1. Block in-use non-replicated to replicated(Metro and Asynchronous)
2. Remove any unused code
3. Differentiate between the production and the management storage groups
4. Remove rollback code on a cleanup_lun, its not necessary on delete and
    will not always work
5. Allow for a target device not to exist on the target array
6. Fix minor issue on metadata on a retype

Closes-Bug: #1899137
Change-Id: I6c7c94528ee94183c1df21c25388505b28f1781a
(cherry picked from commit 92aeec3ad9dbb0482c2531a0b42c06326ae945fd)
'}]
commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Safeguarding retype to some in-use replicated modes

Host assisted migration is a better option for retyping from a non-replicated
to a replicated (Asynchronous and Metro) modes.

1. Block in-use non-replicated to replicated(Metro and Asynchronous)
2. Remove any unused code
3. Differentiate between the production and the management storage groups
4. Remove rollback code on a cleanup_lun, its not necessary on delete and
    will not always work
5. Allow for a target device not to exist on the target array
6. Fix minor issue on metadata on a retype

Closes-Bug: #1899137
Change-Id: I6c7c94528ee94183c1df21c25388505b28f1781a
(cherry picked from commit 92aeec3ad9dbb0482c2531a0b42c06326ae945fd)

commit_message:
Add CinderBackupOptVolumes parameter

This adds a new parameter 'CinderBackupOptVolumes' to allow
cinder-backup to mount extra volumes.

Change-Id: Ide6d464be4a13457debfeceb61e5255c06b67808
(cherry picked from commit 3f8decf175fe79223b78d2153c752a6f368a2275)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-02 18:47:19.000000000', 'message': 'Release openstackdocstheme 2.2.7

The StarlingX docs site utilizes a theme variant within the
openstackdocstheme repo, but consumes packaged releases. A recent
change merged to add a rubric paragraph class to the combined
stylesheet, and the StarlingX community would appreciate a new
openstackdocstheme release to make use of it.

Change-Id: Ib9affcca4f4ac08118e3de11c52210dd89731966
'}]
commit_message:
Release openstackdocstheme 2.2.7

The StarlingX docs site utilizes a theme variant within the
openstackdocstheme repo, but consumes packaged releases. A recent
change merged to add a rubric paragraph class to the combined
stylesheet, and the StarlingX community would appreciate a new
openstackdocstheme release to make use of it.

Change-Id: Ib9affcca4f4ac08118e3de11c52210dd89731966

commit_message:
Update variables for default Zun deployments and AIO

The Zun API added the ability to delete networks in this
microversion which means that tempest tests can be run without the
need to bind the Docker daemon to a wider set of addresses than
localhost.

For the same reason, one tempest test is skipped as this assumes
the Docker daemon is accessible on localhost.

This commit also enables the Zun Horizon UI when Zun is used

Change-Id: Ie41c08f3e8c8c06a8bd334f7d8ec9bf03586ec2b

any subnets do not have IPs free for allocation the migration will

commit_message:
Add steps for confirming IP address allocations and firewall driver

OVN will allocate new ports/IP addresses during the migration, if
any subnets do not have IPs free for allocation the migration will
fail.

We have omitted a step for change of firewall driver to
'openvswtich'.

Change-Id: I3e7d9ee5076375c04df2ef7edc87e18fd0617c7c
Closes-Bug: #1905554
(cherry picked from commit 57d609fa74dd87d3b680bcdc10ca164dda06e026)

Keystone let's users remove role assignments that reference non-existent
users and groups. This is nice when keystone backs to an identity store
like LDAP and users or groups are removed.

Previously, openstackclient would validate the user and group existed in
keystone before sending the request to delete the role assignment. This

commit_message:
Bypass user and group verification in RemoveRole

Keystone let's users remove role assignments that reference non-existent
users and groups. This is nice when keystone backs to an identity store
like LDAP and users or groups are removed.

Previously, openstackclient would validate the user and group existed in
keystone before sending the request to delete the role assignment. This
commit updates the code to bypass that validation so that users can use
IDs to forcibly cleanup role assignments.

Change-Id: I102b41677736bbe37a82abaa3c5b3e1faf2475d5
Story: 2006635
Task: 36848
(cherry picked from commit e24673267093de85beee753860cda1fb224ce4bc)

commit_message:
Fix calling of add_tunnel_port method from sanity checks module

Sanity checks functions which are checking if vxlan and geneve tunnels
are available in openvswitch are now passing all mandatory parameters
to the ovs_lib.OVSBridge.add_tunnel_port method.
Previously port_name was missing.

Closes-Bug: #1905568
Change-Id: Iae86705f1d30c89dc5482261d852b45787bd8782

commit_message:
Release os-win for wallaby-1 milestone

This is a library release for os-win for the wallaby-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

Change-Id: I9a6d8bbf4972694e29cff65be684cdd3ce057af9

In ci/roles/network/tasks/main.yml I am using filters directly with the variable name used to create the NW. Filter here is case sensitive (False works). Shall I keep false as the value and change the first letter to uppercase in the filters task?
```
- name: Gather networks info
  openstack.cloud.networks_info:
     cloud: "{{ cloud }}"
     name: "{{ network_name }}"
     filters:
       shared: "{{ network_shared }}"
```'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-11-24 20:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Migrating networks_info from AnsibleModule to OpenStackModule

Migrated networks_info module to OpenStackModule and updated playbook to test the module in CI jobs. Added deprecated_names tyo module.
Removed "ansible-deprecated-no-collection-name" exception for networks_info for ansible 2.10 and 2.11. Reverted 'False' to 'false' and updated filters (case sensitive) to check for 'False' instead

Change-Id: I85e19f0db8b4ee549137249477d0b7f5d82e9865

>\xa0AFAICT cephadm doesn't configure the firewall [1] 

yes it does, so if you manage firewall rules on your own then you will need to disable it on bootstrap for instance [1].

Keep in mind that EL8 uses firewalld but the default backend isn't iptables anymore but nftables (FirewallBackend=nftables in the config), that's probably why iptables is empty.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/master/src/cephadm/cephadm#L5812-L5815"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-11-03 21:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-03 22:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-11-04 13:16:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 33:

(2 comments)

> >\xa0AFAICT cephadm doesn't configure the firewall [1]
 > 
 > yes it does, so if you manage firewall rules on your own then you
 > will need to disable it on bootstrap for instance [1].
 > 
 > Keep in mind that EL8 uses firewalld but the default backend isn't
 > iptables anymore but nftables (FirewallBackend=nftables in the
 > config), that's probably why iptables is empty.
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/master/src/cephadm/cephadm#L5812-L5815

Thanks Dimitri. My mistake for bringing up iptables. I'll update the spec to state that we'll use `--skip-firewalld`."}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-11-04 13:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 34.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2020-11-04 15:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34: Code-Review+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-21 13:46:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix: listing volumes with filters

This patch includes 2 fix for the following issues:

1) ast.literal_eval() doesn't work with int and float values
See comment inline

2) Do not traverse and modify the same dict:
while traversing filters dict, we're modifying it inside the loop
which distorts the order of elements (adding modified elements in the
end). to fix this, i've used a temp dict that will be used to traverse
and modification will be done in the filters dict.

Closes-Bug: #1883490

Change-Id: I18b4b0b1b71904b766f7b89df49f5539e3c7662a
(cherry picked from commit aed94a76cf62fdaedff793c7a9d998920b56c072)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix: listing volumes with filters

This patch includes 2 fix for the following issues:

1) ast.literal_eval() doesn't work with int and float values
See comment inline

2) Do not traverse and modify the same dict:
while traversing filters dict, we're modifying it inside the loop
which distorts the order of elements (adding modified elements in the
end). to fix this, i've used a temp dict that will be used to traverse
and modification will be done in the filters dict.

Closes-Bug: #1883490

Change-Id: I18b4b0b1b71904b766f7b89df49f5539e3c7662a
(cherry picked from commit aed94a76cf62fdaedff793c7a9d998920b56c072)
